text: Wow, great work!  We brought him a very difficult job.  We needed him to somehow extend our Can Am Spyder seat 5 inches back to give the passenger more room...and we needed him to somehow make it all look good and yet be comfortable too.  This was way beyond just recovering a motorcycle seat.  He had to fabricate, and carve the foam, and do a whole bunch of really CUSTOM WORK.  He did it beautifully, and he did it in a timely manner, too.  Very professional job at a price that was more than fair.  We were very pleased and would definitely recommend him.

text: These are the same people running this place that threatened to beat up my 72 disabled husband at the university Toyota when we discovered the $600.00 hidden documentation fee they hide under their hand while you are signing the legal papers. We love the Toyota but will never buy from these thugs again It is on the left side of the first paper you sign so they can hide by holding their hand over it. The doc fee is the only figures that are on the left side of the paper. That is on purpose so they can steal from you with thrift by deception. We  were cursed at and chased out of the show room and into the parking lot by their used car sales manager Andy Chitwood. They never apologized for his actions so it seems the home office are dishonest thugs as well. I am told they do not own the Toyota dealership now. THANK G O D. I just wish I could give them a zero but one is as low as this review lets me go. Ps as of last week I have told over 6k people about our horrible experience there. If you buy from them watch for hidden.

text: Can’t recommend Thrower’s enough. The staff here is incredibly kind. They made me feel comfortable while I waited for a repair as an out-of-towner. The service was quick, but thorough and well-priced. I felt much safer driving my car two hours home.

text: Tow company associated w this shop took care of our daughter like she was their own when she had a wreck on I-85 in Shorter. Thrower's.

name: Jennifer Middleton
text: My daughter was on the interstate on the way home from AU for the holidays when she started rapidly losing tire pressure. She pulled off the interstate at the next exit which was Tuskegee and luckily we were finally able to find this place. I called ahead and they were waiting for her and got to work on her car immediately knowing she was trying to get home (4 hours away) before dark. They quickly checked all tires to make sure they had no leaks, determined it was from the weather, filled them up and rotated them for next to nothing. Thank goodness for these good and kind people, my baby will be home safe and soon! I highly recommend for good honest service.

name: E K
text: Chris and his team are great! They are honest and dependable. They don't try to take you for everything you have. They identify the issue, they fix it and you're on your way. No trying to sell you services you don't need, and they actually listen to your concerns! I would recommend anyone to them.

text: I came to Throwers because of a tire having a screw in it. When I got there the staff was nice and welcoming they addressed my issues and said it would only take a few minutes. While I was waiting, I noticed that the staff knew the first names of the customers that came in. A good sign. When they came back with my keys they informed me that the screw didn’t penetrate my tire and that I was all good. The best part, they didn’t charge me a thing! If you need work done on your vehicle I would highly recommend them!!!

The mechanic agreed to assist but explained that I needed to ask the owner because it was close to closing time... I even and offered to pay more because I had more than 30 miles to drive. I was denied service as a female from the owner because it was 5:02 but there were working on more than one car and all of the garage doors were open! So apparently there were still open   and no one else was asking for service but I was denied. I DO NOT RECOMMEND because of poor customer service from I’m assuming the manger or owner (Chris).

name: Justin Heslep
text: I highly recommend SKK Enterprises for all your car audio needs. They perform a wide range of other work as well. I recently had them install an amplifier and subwoofer to upgrade my existing audio set up in my Infiniti. The installation was performed quickly and professionally at a competitive price. These gentlemen are true professionals. They also made adjustments to my audio settings and hid the wires for a clean look. They performed a test after install to ensure all components were working as intended. The owner Seth was very polite and knowledgeable to help me with my needs. The owner also told me that all his work is guaranteed and if I should ever have any trouble they will take care of it. I would definitely give these guys a call and I cannot thank them enough! My new audio setup sounds amazing and looks great too!

Have owned GM products for 45 years and this is by far the worst dealership  i have worked with. They have some good people but leadership is wanting.

I had an oil change done on my Volkswagen.  the staff was very friendly from the time I came through the door.  I really liked that when I pulled up to the Service lane they opened the door and I was able to drive in, then the waiting room was just inside the door.
I will be back for my next service.

text: I had a great experience at Brooks Motor service department they were kind and very friendly also everything was done in a timely manner

name: Richard Brewton
text:
I looked for over a month for the SIERRA I wanted. I had received several emails from Brooks but because of the distance from home I avoided making the drive.  After a frustrating Saturday talking to other dealers, I told my wife Rae I was driving to Thomasville Monday to see what they had.  Rae suggested we make the drive that afternoon.

I never expected to be driving a new SIERRA home that afternoon.

We arrived at Brooks late on Saturday afternoon.  I walked on the lot and found the Sierra I had wanted all along.  Neil was very helpful with the test drive and answering our question.

I had done a lot of research on USAA's car buying site and TrueCar's site as will.  When Neil presented Brooks pricing, it was well within the range  I expected to pay.  The financing was in line with the research I had done as well.

Neil, Kelly and Preston were very gracious staying after hours to complete our transaction.

Rae and I agreed this was the best experience either of us had ever experienced when purchasing a new vehicle. Relaxed, no anxiety and we left totally satisfied with every aspect of the transaction.

Thank you to all!!

PS: THE COOKIES WERE FABULOUS !!!!

resp.text: We're happy to hear that you found our staff so helpful, Richard! We sincerely appreciate your business and kind review. We hope to see you again in the future! Safe travels!

name: William Odom
text: I would like to invite anyone and everyone that is wanting to buy a new or used vehicle you should go to Brooks Chevrolet and Thomasville Alabama I promise you that you won't have that feeling of being harassed or pressured ... These guys are awesome !!

name: Erin Andrews
text:
Came to the dealership explaining my vehicle is randomly stalling out. Which is extremely dangerous. If I stalled out in a busy intersection, red light, or train tracks, I could die. And this is the car I carry my 2 babies in. I've worked in the service department industry for years and years before I had my kids and from my knowledge it's a liability to turn away a customer if their car is doing anything that could put you in danger. Well, this dealership did.

That's okay though. I'll call a lawyer if anything happens to me or my family. I'm headed to Chris Myers GMC.

name: Josh Brewer
text: This is the best shop around, I am fairly new to Off-roading and building a vehicle to do it in. Josh, Devin, and Paul have all been extremely helpful and informative. Josh helped figure out what suspension I needed for the future of my build and helped explain the pros and cons and what fits my needs and price ranges. Devon helped out anytime I called to follow up on when parts where coming in along with the progress during the day of install. Paul man this guy is the one you want looking over labor, he is very OCD about getting it right and not cutting corners and has a wealth of knowledge. Additionally all the staff at Elite are very professional and will answer any question you have, if they can’t answer it then they will make sure they get you the answer with some digging. I will maintain being a happy customer with a trusted shop which is hard to find. I can’t wait to do future building with the Elite family! Oh by the way check out all their social media and advertisements they are top notch!

name: Anthony Danshaw
text: Highly recommended! I have had engine work and tires and shocks through them! Great service and advice! Almost anything you want from lights to custom fab work, they got you covered. 100% satisfied with the quality of service and work done!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.

name: G whitts
text: These guys are very transparent and polite. The turn around time was quicker than anticipated. Most importantly, they’re honest and do excellent work. I will not hesitate to use them in the future for vehicle needs and wants.

name: Grant Johnson
text:
Recently bought a new to me Jeep TJ. I couldn’t even drive it home (15 mins away from place of purchase) due to death wobble, loose steering wore out track bar and a laundry list of other issues. I had little to no hope for getting the vehicle street worthy and planned on just keeping it as a dedicated trailer rig. I called Elite and spoke with Josh over the phone, he said they can get it fixed up and back on the road.

They absolutely blew my expectations with the work put in on my jeep. They replaced all heim joints on the steering and track bar as well as completed a full inspection on the vehicle torque checking all nuts and bolts under the vehicle my peace of mind. They even found a few more issues that were fixed in shop for safety reasons on this inspection.

The whole process was seamless from drop off to pickup. Communication was top notch on any issue they ran into along the way. I will absolutely be returning to get my truck leveled with wheels and tires in the near future. Awesome job and awesome company. ⭐️ 12/10stars ⭐️

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review Grant glad we could get your Jeep back drivable!

name: allen holmes
text: Jimmy, Alex, and Josh did an awesome job on my 2013 JK. Thanks and I will be back to get more did soon.

resp.text: Thank you Allen we look forward to working with you more!

name: John DeJarnette
text: Highly recommend!!!  Incredible job done by Elite and their professional and knowledgeable staff. Brought my 2020 TRD Pro up to speed with a 2/1 lift and some 285/70/17 Nitto Ridge Grapplers. Great work done by a great team.  Elite now has my TRD Pro looking like it always should have.

resp.text: Glad we could help you make it happen!

name: Susan Sims
text: The guys at Elite are nice and professional. They answered all my questions on building my Jeep Gladiator and steered me in the right direction for certain parts. And it was completed in 1 day!!! Already planning to return to have more modifications.

name: Randy Reeder
text: Josh and the guys at Elite Offroad were great. Super helpful and very knowledgeable. 10/10 would recommend

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your build!!

name: M O
text: Rip off.. took my Yukon in for an alignment they called and said it was ready. Then told me 119bucks payed they handed me my keys then said oh BTW we couldn't do the alignment it needed new tie rod end inners and ball joints. And said the amount I payed was for the inspection.. I didn't want an inspection but a alignment. So I took the yukon home and replaced all the parts to find out it was fine. Only had alittle play in upper right ball joint the mechanic is a joke only trying to fill his pockets this is why you can't trust auto shops.  Stay away because you are gonna get ripped off!!.  I Am Mike Overton and I Approve This Message!!!

resp.text:
Hey Mike Overton we are sorry you feel this way but we did not perform an alignment due to worn out suspension and steering components. You getting charged was a mistake by your sales person which was corrected and you were given a refund. We pride ourselves in quality work we do not change for a service we cannot perform any other shop would have performed an “Alignment” and not let you know about any front end issues and charged you.

Thanks,
Josh Balch

name: brandon horton
text: Josh and the crew did great work on my Jeep installing some items I needed to get a better ride. Also had a emergency front drive shaft problem and they was able to put the part on the same day and had it in stock. Great group of people

name: Shaun Fassina
text: The guys at Elite went above and beyond helping me get my Gladiator sorted.  It's like all the best guys at different shops decided to go in together and open  the "Elite" shop for off-roading.  They had the best prices, got the work done ahead of schedule and got it done right the very first time.  Extremely helpful and very attentive to what I wanted.  Solid advice, never tried to up sell, and was fast to respond.  Great communication even before I let them know I was going to use them.  Solid group of guys.  I have dealt with a few of the more popular off road shops in town and this was by far my best experience

resp.text: Thank you for the review Shaun we look forward to working with you more!

name: Jamie Carr
text: Josh, Patrick, Alex, and the rest of the crew here do excellent work. From basic to total custom fab. Check them out if you get in the area or online. Prices are great and fair. Local shop, not big box chain that makes you just a number in the cash register.

text:
Customer service was excellent, everyone I met actually seemed to take pride in what they do and it especially showed in the work done. Got my truck leveled and labor cost was very competitive and work was done in a timely manner. Highly recommend this place, my five star experience started when they picked up the phone with an optimistic attitude. Hard to find that these day’s.
Thanks guys

name: Kyle Alvis
text: Great guys there! They really helped me decide what suspension I needed to go with to suite my needs. I have since been there multiple times to keep the build going. Their service department is second to none. They will sit and explain all specifications of your build to you. I highly recommend them and send all my friends and family to them for any of their automotive needs.

name: Stephen King
text: They We’re very professional. I dropped my jeep off and within minutes they had it a lift and showed me all of my options. They weren’t high pressure like most of the shops I visited. We went over several options, and I chose the one best for my budget. They were by far the most affordable. I checked all the 4x4 shops in the Birmingham areas and they saved me 20% minimum. I would highly recommend Elite Off-road and Performance. They are miles above the competition!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Stephen we look forward to working with you more.

They have solid prices on parts and can usually have it shipped faster than most sites!

All in all I would recommend this shop and its staff everytime. great customer service and amazing turnaround. I had other shops tell me up to 14 days. they had it done in 3.

text: Thank you Josh and the guys at Elite offroad! My husband couldn't be happier with his new brush guard and running boards. Elite Offroad is very knowledgeable and helpful. I highly recommend Elite offroad to anyone I know!

text: DO NOT DO BUISNESS WITH THESE GUYS! They worked on my car, was there to be gone over, checked over and to fix the leaks, as well as new plugs, new rear end gear, and to address an electrical issue. The car was deilevered to me, and It leaks oil, transmission fluid, rear end fluid, and gas.. the car wont run longer then 5 min or a couple miles without drawing the battery down and dieing.. these guys charged $2,914.90 to fix my car and had it over 4 months..and came out worse then when it went in.. and of course Josh (the owner) doesn't want to stand behind his work, or pay to have it fixed correctly! This guy scammed almost $3,000 is what it boils down to, and had my car over 4 months with every excuse in the world as to why it wasn't done yet.. I do NOT recommend using this place, they are a JOKE!

name: Ken Osvath
text:
Highly recommend.  Thanks once again to Elite Offroad And Performance!  We’ve had great experiences working with Josh and Alex.

Previously EOP had stayed late waiting for a towed Jeep arrival when our son’s track bar mount broke, rendering it un-drivable.

They fixed it in a timely and cost-effective manner, installing a new adjustable track bar and Teraflex front lower adjustable control arms which significantly improved drive quality.

Then recently I swung by and picked up a HIKEit X9 Throttle Controller for my Jeep, from Alex, as a cost-effective performance upgrade.

OMG!  What a difference!   Just as EOP advertised — it’s easy of use, adjustable Throttle Response with 36 settings within its 4-driving modes (Cruise, Sport, Race, Eco/4x4 Crawl) and Auto mode that adjusts dynamically to your driving along with Anti-Theft Password Protected Pedal Lock.   Thanks EOP!

name: Kevin Ingram
text: The guys at Elite Offroad and performance really go the extra mile . I enjoyed meeting them, and i would recommend them for all your offroad needs. Josh and Paul are some really good guys. Glad i got to meet them

name: Chanse LaShai
text:
Couple years back, brought in my vehicle and asked them to check over everything to make sure it would be good for a 1500 mile journey. They only took 30 minutes, topped my fluids, and sent me on my way with the all-clear. Went elsewhere for a second opinion and they were shocked that Gill's blatantly missed (or didn't even check) that I had some serious suspension issues as well as separating tires.

Fast forward to earlier this year. Boyfriend's new car had a clutch failure. Ordered a conversion kit online to do ourselves. After not being able to put it back together it was brought to Gill's. It turned out the company we ordered from sent us the wrong kit. Gill's said it would be a week or so. After hearing nothing, had to call and see where progress was, got some excuse about why it wasn't done yet. Okay, not a big deal but should have been kept up to date. Week after week of not being kept up to date, and hearing excuse after excuse as to why, 2 months later car is ready. Car feels great, except for a weird rumbling sensation that wasn't there before. Oh well, not sure what it is. Notice a bolt just sitting in the console that wasn't there before. Turns out they didn't even connect the steering column. Thank goodness it didn't give out and KILL US while driving down 280 for the week we couldn't figure out the rumbling/random bolt. Won't ever return, and will always warn people from here on out.

name: April Renfro
text: I purchased an engine from here, was guaranteed motor was good. Paid for it over the phone and picked it up the next day. After getting the motor in it was knocking called and talked to a lady who said owner wasn’t in and he’ll give me a call back, he never called me back. I called a couple days later and he answered I let him know what was going on and he said you only have a 30 day warranty, when in fact my paperwork states I had 60. Thank god I had kept the receipt. He told me I had to fill out the warranty paperwork and present receipts. Ok no problem but on the warranty form it states that the timing belt needs to be replaced, this engine has a chain. He informed me that regardless belt or chain it’s all the same. Well I got some news from you buddy there not, a chain shouldn’t have to be serviced under normal conditions, a belt yes I agree it does. But if the motor is knocking that has nothing to do with it. This is a fair warning for anyone purchasing from here he will not refund your money and will think of any way possible not too, and he uses the square app which makes things much harder to get a refund through your credit card. But I am happy to say after over 8 months I have received my refund and hope this guy flies out of business and really feels it. I tried to do the rite thing and not go through my card company but in the end they took care of it. And I really hope this guy goes out of business.

resp.text: Hi April.  We do not have a record of you ever purchasing anything with us.  We recommend that if any item is purchased from American Salvage and is under warranty that it be brought back to our location for inspection.

name: D Atkins
text: On 3/3/21 I had the best experience with a repair shop. Richard was the most kind, personable, and knowledgeable repairman I have ever met. I called to see if Auto Wiz had an opening and he asked me in the most respectable way to call back in a couple of hours. When I did he told me to bring the car in. I asked him to check it out for me before I purchased the used car. While he was checking it he showed me some problems with the car and asked me for a price range that KBB had it for. When I told him he suggested that I pay less than the highest amount in KBB. Armed with the report from Auto Wiz, I went back to the seller and offered less than what I originally offered and saved $1200. Richard, thank you so much! Not only will I take my car there from now on, I will definitely recommend Auto Whiz on Valleydale Rd. to other people.

text: I have used Auto Whiz for several years, Mike is awesome and so are all the guys there! They have worked on two different vehicles for me- one a small truck and second an AWD SUV. I am always impressed by the friendliness, promptness and quality of work preformed. Suggestions are accurate and forward thinking to prevent accidents or unexpected repairs but also budget friendly.  If you need perspective they will also assist. I have done maintenance (oil change/ tire rotation), brakes and tires here and have been pleased with every visit. There is a strip mall behind the shop and it is very easy to have lunch or go to nail boutique while they do repair or maintance. Highly recommmend!!

text: Great service. Honest. I had an engine light issue. They fixed it and a few days later it came back on. Took it back and they reset it checked a couple of things and told me it was the computer had not completely reset. Said if it came on again bring it back. It hasn't and they never charged me for the visit. Prices are very reasonable.

name: Dreamcatcher ENT
text: Terrible service. Rude desk personnel. Rip off artists. I would not recommend this to anyone at all. ZERO STARS. Every oil change we've had they didn't fill it up to the required levels, gave us an estimate on a job that was $1000. Went to another shop and got the exact same job done with a lifetime guarantee for $175.00.

name: Hydro
text: So many good experiences here .Roger and the team are affordable, courteous and honest.

name: Jim Crapia
text: Best shop in these parts. Great service, honest fast work.

name: Jerry Murrel
text:
One of the most impressive auto repair shops I've had the pleasure of returning to.  Their prices are very reasonable, they do excellent work, and are honest.

Roger took the time to explain the work done on my A/C, and explained to me that there may still be a very slow leak which could be expensive to repair, if it turns out to be the evaporator.  Such leaks are very hard to detect, and could require removing the dash and steering wheel. He was basically letting me know it wouldn't be worth spending the money for that repair, should the leak re-occur and it be in the evaporator.

I've also bought tires from them, in addition to having my air conditioning system worked on here, and I've been satisfied with the results both times.  I recommend Auto Whiz without reservation.

name: J, Dugan
text:
I have used Auto Whiz numerous times and have had nothing but great experiences every time. They are quick, and courteous and do a very good job. I have had everything from tires, to oil changes, sensor changes and tune ups and have NEVER had either bad service or a bad job done. One time the owners wife actually drove me to work while they worked on my car!! Now if that isn't going above and beyond the call of duty I don't know what is.
If you want a great job, excellent service and courteous respectful employees you should definately try Auto Whiz!!

name: John Fuller
text: Great place to have your car serviced.

name: Tim Murphy
text: These are very inconsiderate auto mechanics that I have dealt with in an auto shop. Both my wife and I have had $1000s of dollars worth of work done to our cars over the years. I called in to ask a simple question for concern of my wife's vehicle and the first man "Buddy" hung up the phone while I was mid sentence. I called back, this time "Roger" answered, he acted like he couldn't hear me until I said I need to bring my wife's car in, that got his attention. When I began asking my questions again he quickly rushed me off the phone again with out considering our concern. I do not recommend this shop to anyone and will never bring our cars there again. What happened to family auto shops that show concern for their customers???

text: This is the worst shop ever. I got 2 new tires put on my car and 3 days later one of them just fell straight off and my car slide from the road onto the dirt and I was 2 feet from a huge ditch that would have killed me, i'm just glad I didn't have my son. Well at first they say they will fix it and do the right thing, so I wasn't that upset, but after 6 hours of waiting and they paid for the tow and they said they would pay my rental fees and fix my car, well suddenly the next day the other owner says no that I did the damage, can you believe that. After spending 6 hours the day before and the shop owner or manager even admitting he messed up and paid my tow and got me in a rental or now trying to say they will not fix my messed up suspension or the body damage it did when the tire came off and front of car sunk into the ground. DO NOT GO TO THIS SHOP IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE. THIS IS THE WORST AND I MEAN THE WORST AUTO SHOP I HAVE EVER BEEN TOO. HOW HARD IS IT TO PUT ON NEW TIRES, THEY ARE LIARS AND JUST SAY WHAT YOU WANT TO HEAR THAN CHANGE THEIR MIND. I'LL BE SEEING THEM IN COURT. BUT PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE UNLESS YOU WANT CRAPPY WORK FOR A HIGH PRICE.

name: Jonathan Pettus
text:
I'm not satisfied because I ordered an alternator on Wednesday around 11am. Was told it would arrive around noon on the next day, Christmas eve day. I called and was told it had not been ordered. I'm a disabled kidney dialysis patient and I depend on this little truck to get me to the dialysis center. I had to re-order the alternator and I have to wait until Monday after Christmas before I can get the truck fixed. This is only the most recent issue from this store I've experienced. Please, can someone hire a more competent employee....  UPDATE ... I called again on Monday after Christmas and was told that they ordered a starter by mistake. I  can not believe the incompetence of the employees here.

It seems that the responder to this post has also failed to pay attention. Is this a company wide incompetence? In the future I would suggest using other automotive parts dealers. No, i have not gotten the alternator yet. But I do hope the other store i ordered from has the correct part. I am planning on picking it up today.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience caused by our Opp location with the ordering of your alternator. It sounds as if they have handled it correctly now but feel free to keep us updated. We will be forwarding your review to the Field Leadership of the store so they can see how their customers feel about the service provided and address it as needed. We hope to see you return and thank you for choosing Advance.

name: Alison Gentry
text: Wish I could give no stars for the rude sales manager and all five stars to Jonathan the salesman. He should be a manager! Very friendly, understanding, and respectful. We made an offer on a truck that was only $900 less than asking price. We also wanted to know trade in value for current car. Jonathan came back and the manager said he wanted full price of sticker and lowballed $2000 less than what the trade in was worth! Did not even give a counteroffer. We thanked Jonathan and said we would keep an eye out for anything else that came up we might like. Super nice guy. As we were about to get up to leave the manager came over and started yelling at us and bashing us for the offer we made! I was shocked! He kept telling us we had no idea how much the truck was worth. The offer we made was reasonable for the truck. We told him he could not give us the numbers we wanted so we were leaving. Yet he kept yelling at us and trying to tell us we were wrong! Terrible customer service. A manager should not yell at two customers telling us we are wrong because of an offer.

name: Melanie Shelly
text:
I found the car I love 2018 Nissan Maxima. I live about an hour and a half away so I really love it!  I did all my negotiating via email and set up a test drive appointment. Very, very, easy sale for the company. My biggest disappointment is the fact that the car was filthy when I arrived and the battery terminals were severely corroded. I am convinced nobody from the service department even looked under the hood until I made them.  I wanted the terminals cleaned,  I wanted an oil change,  all fluids topped off and a cabin air filter change (Very minimal requests for a car dealership) I stated it would have to be detailed inside. The detail department worked on it but they would only be there until 12 or 12:30. So we concluded our business (paid cash) and I went to lunch without the car.  Well by the time I got back the headliner was much cleaner but it smelled terribly in the car (like stagnant mop water). Nothing else was even wiped down and unfortunately the detail department was gone. There was sticky crusted disgusting something in all the buttons so some would stick in certain positions. Literally the battery terminal was only brushed with a wire brush to knock off the corrosion. I don't think the oil was changed. When I got home the oil did not appear new. I think they put new on top of the old then they mixed together. The cabin air filter was not changed. I removed it to check because everytime I used recirculated air instead of fresh it smelled bad. It has a new one now and it no longer has an odor.

My salesman was okay, but seriously the easiest commission ever. Wish I would have at least gotten an after the sale phone call. Just to check in. Would have made me feel better about the other issues.

My complaints are only directed to the service and detail departments.

I am now looking for a truck in the $20,000 range (same as my Maxima) and I am not even looking at this company now.

name: Cameron Martin
text:
I was at SKCO Automotive today. I had been there for almost 5 hours. My salesman was actually a nice  man, so i have absolutely nothing bad to say about him.  After going through this ridiculous process of trying to prove my income for 2-3 hours and trying to be put in a car  the finance company wanted me to have. I was exhausted, over it and ready to leave. As if that wasn’t enough, someone decided to make a big deal out of nothing. My children went ahead of me and went to the door. They were holding the door for each other and then was holding it for me, waiting for me to catch up and come out. Before I got to the door they were approached by a lady. She told my children to either go out the door or go find their moma or daddy and they they were letting the air out. I was appalled!! I asked her what was the problem. I asked her name and she mumbled something and I asked her again and she told me she didn’t owe me an explanation!!  Come to find out she was the owner. The salesman walked up to me try to find out what was going on. She began to butt in, so then the gentleman walked me out the door to discuss it. it started to rain, he offered to grab an umbrella for me. We make our way into the building and the owner runs up to the salesman and tells him he is her employee and He better not walk me out the door. How pathetic and nasty can a human be over nothing!!
I’m sick of people  acting ignorant for no reason towards me. So needless to say I left all deals on the table and vowed to make it known that I would never spend a dime with a company that doesn’t value my business or dollar. So it’s above me now!!

And so far from what I hear the cars are junk! A friend of mine bought a van and the alternator went out 2 days after she purchased it.

Oh and if you plan on buying a car using your business name don’t waste your time. Apparently they don’t know how to process those sales!

name: Amanda Unrue
text:
Buying a car wasn't bad.  But they have this policy of holding the spare keys until you pick up your paperwork.  I informed them that I was going to be moving and might not be in town to pick up the spare key.  The guy who was doing my paperwork said that he would mail it to my new address(even though that is apparently against policy).  The paperwork arrived in the mail, but the spare key never did.  I called them back to check the status of that and they are now saying that they have no record of a spare key but that I can bring the car into the dealership, pay them about $400, and they'll make a new key.  So now some random person has the spare key to my car, which I find a little sketch.
**As a side note, it is my opinion that the office manager is incredibly incompetent and rude.

name: James Wilson
text: I came into SKCO Automotive to buy a Nissan Sentra that I seen online. the salesperson, a Mr. Billy Keene, informed me of an issue with this particular car. He showed me evidence that it was in need of service, however minor, before it could be sold. He actually took the car to the service department and fussed at the service manager telling him that, "I have a man here to buy this car and you all could have had this ready a week ago." Billy persisted until the service department took care of the issue. He and I sat while they took care of the issue and I found him to be very astute about all sorts of subjects regarding cars and how financing works. He took time with me he did not have to take. He also made it possible that the car that i wanted was serviced before I left in it a few hours later. I cant say enough about this salesman, and also about the sales manager, a Mr. Joe. The Dealership as a whole was easy to deal with and Billy and Joe were actually able to get me out the door $500 less than the advertised price. If you need a good quality vehicle, i highly recomend SKCO, and really recomend dealing with Billy.

The work was top notch and the shaft fit back in the car perfectly (they put in new U-joints) and is balanced to a T . The cost was fair and even BELOW what they quoted me on the phone . The car runs down the hwy at 80mph  like new. Great job guys !!

It wasn't visible and would've had to be deliberately stolen. Can't prove it, but this was only place that had access to the inside of my vehicle. Won't be back for my suspicions as well as the conversations that day in the shop regarding ammo, finding ammo, etc.

name: Phillip Smart
text:
On may 9th 2020  I purchased tires from the Mavis on Highway 31 in Pelham. I went with the discount tires, because the last set I got from a Mavis ( trussville AL) lasted a decent amount of time mileage wise.
Here is my list of grievances
1. About two weeks later, I noticed one of the lug nuts was almost falling off. One round and it would have been off on the ground .This infuriates me even more, because I specifically instructed the technician to make sure I could get the lugs off with a regular lug wrench, as I do my own tire rotation and oil change every 5-7.5k. Three of the lugs were so tight I had to stand on the hands. Again, one was falling off, three were almost impossible to remove.
2. of course I got talked into the 89$ alignment
3. Its not my vehicle ( wife ), so it took me a couple of weeks to notice the bad vibration at 70mph, so back to the shop to get tires re balanced, which I already pay 75$ for. I did not go back to the Mavis because I don't trust them. They couldn't even tighten my lugs
4. When I get to the new tire place, I find out that all of my tires are set to 41 psi. 41!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Now the tires are cupping, which means they will need to be replaced soon.
5. One of the tires was out of balance

They were super quick to get an alignment and do it, but they couldn't even get my lugs on and get the tire pressure right?
This place is an embarrassment.

resp.text: We apologize, Phillip, We at Mavis believe you deserve nothing short of the best. We're so sorry for your experience. Your feedback is truly valued. You're right Phillip and we need to do better than this for you. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

I had assumed sense their online system allowed me to pick the tires an day an time of install that the tires must be in stock on in a local warehouse that they get delivers from...   Guess I was wrong.   Would have been nice if something was said when I dropped the van off or when they noticed they did not have the tires I had requested.     But that would have required good customer service.   Gave one star because it would not let me post NO STAR

name: Nick Lions
text: I picked my tires on their website July 15th and scheduled install on July 19th at 9am. I ordered the 3rd set of tires down the list that were recommended for my vehicle (2017 Ford Transit 250), Michelin Defender T+H. I work 6-7 days a week as a contractor so Sunday was really my only option to get tires on my work vehicle. I arrived early for my appointment, confirmed my appointment, and confirmed the tires with the employee behind the sales counter. I confirmed that the tires I ordered will be the best fit for my vehicle with the employee and he said they will be great for it. So my wife picked me up and we went about our day. I received a phone call at 11:18 informing me the tires are installed on my vehicle but they’re not going to work then proceeded to tell me they can order the correct tires for it but they won’t be here till Tuesday July 21st. I explained I can’t just leave my vehicle up there not working for 2 days, and asked if they can just put my old tires back on the van. The employee responded with yes but we will have to charge you for mount and balance, my only request was to install the tires with the best tread on the rear which he agreed to. I received a second call at 4:10 stating my vehicle was ready but that they close at 5 and needed to be there before 5 to pick it up. I arrived paid the clerk $75.96, received my keys, walked out to my truck to find my tires low, tire light on and the rear tires (almost bald) on the passenger side and the front tires (still had a good amount of tread on them) on the drivers side which was not what I asked. I asked if they could add some air to my tires and get my tire light to turn off. They did add air to my tires but when I asked about the tire light the manager had to stop putting Alabama stickers on his truck brought a computer tpms sensor out and showed me very quickly the tire pressure was fine and told me this would be expected with used tires... My tire light never went off like he said it would. Today is July 29th and I have yet to receive a phone call stating my tires have arrived or a update. I emailed Mavis corporate on July 23rd and have not received a response or anything. Never once did anyone apologize for the inconvenience that this mishap caused me that was clearly Mavis Tires fault and caused me to pay for their mistake. I at no point complained or expressed any frustration to the employees there because I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. I don’t ever leave bad reviews for businesses because I know what that can do to a business, but I did want to take a minute and send you a email about my experience. I ended up purchasing a set of tires from Discount Tires on Hwy 280 and it was a great experience. I called them in the morning they called me as soon as the tires arrived, and installed them the same day in less then 1 hour after leaving my vehicle with them. Upon arrival there was no tire light on and the tires had the proper amount of air in them. I hope this email helps in one way or form, I’m not complaining but just find it hard to understand why Mavis Discount tire would charge a customer any amount of money for a issue/mistake on their end.

text: Had a simple oil change done at this location got home and noticed oil pouring out of my car. Brought back to the store for them to fix. I’m guess it the leftover oil because they said it couldn’t be anything else or it must be a leak somewhere else. I said the car wasn’t leaking when I brought it. They lost my business from this point on if you’re mechanic can’t do a simple oil change without checking it for leaks. Now i have a car with oil leak. name: chevy3girl
text: Charged me $400 to fix an evap core for air conditioner, then sent me home KNOWING it was leaking freon from a line they botched (after keeping my car for a week and a half waiting on the part).  They refused to fix the line (told me I needed to have a part welded, which was a lie) even though it was their mistake on the brand new part they just put on. I had to buy a repair kit to fix what they messed up. $15 repair kit and they refused to make it right after taking $400 from me. If you can't stand behind your work, you don't need to be in business. I'll never use them again.

name: Shawn Sipes
text: Dixon's has been my Go-To shop since the day I got my driver's license. I'm 37 now and still use Dixon's any time need repair to a cooling or air conditioning system. Thankfully I've not had to use them to fix anymore "over confident young boy" misshaps but years ago they fixed many of them I didn't even think we're fixable. I took a radiator in after a teenage bet gone wrong. I was taking it in so he could see which radiator to order me. He said something to the effect of why pay for a new one when I can fix that one for less than half the price. He done great on it. I've heard they are great about warranting their work but I can't personally speak on that. Of all the things I've took him to fix over the years, I've never had an issue with any of their work that required me to take it back. Also my a/c quit on my truck due to advance Auto selling me the wrong part. Long story short advance Auto settled with me on just giving me every single part to put a complete new a/c system on it. So I stopped by Dixon's to see how much to flush it out after the the parts were put on on plus charge the system with freon. They priced it to me. Out of curiosity I asked how much it'd cost to put the parts on too. There was only $50 difference! So they have more than fair prices!

text: Heading into Birmingham from out of town,  I had some engine problems.  The staff here were incredible.  They were able to find a part I didn't think was available for my volvo and fixed my car and got me on my way.  They helped me get a rental and kept me in the loop.  The fee was very fair and the work was prompt and perfectly done.  I love these guys.  I wish I had them in Columbus,  Georgia. Thank you for your help.

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: These guys are great! I'm always leery of the auto parts place when I'm alone, since I'm a woman and I know some places try to take advantage.  The nice man at Napa listened to the tale of my sketchy car and decided to just test my battery.  When he found that the cable things were loose, but my battery was fine, he tightened them for me and just told me to come back tomorrow if that didn't help.  No Talking down to me or trying to sell me anything.  Perfect experience!

name: Charles Nolan
text: My daughter had a terrible shaking in her steering. Her boss suggested Automasters due to good experiences he has had there. They told her the tire she was driving on was dangerous because it had developed a bulge. They also told her she needed new rear brakes. I'm sure most of you are like me tired of being ripped by dishonest repair places. Well, to my surprise this place was honest, they told her exactly what was wrong, and fixed it right, and they gave me a reasonable price.  I highly recommend Automasters for that reason. Just give them a call, talk to them, I think you will agree. I'm so glad we have the ability to review places now. It feels great to get one that does you wrong, but feels even better to help a company who chooses to treat you right. Thanks to Brooks and the whole gang for taking care of my daughter. I will be back!

text: I bought more brake fluid than I needed and misplaced the receipt. It was the Napa brand and unopened. What a terrible customer service experience. Is Napa living on the 80's? I have too many choices to do business with a place that doesn't have a better system.

The shop manager Tom has the IQ and personality of a freshly dropped dog turd, and is about as trusting as a rattlesnake with a pet me sign. I wouldn't even recommend these guys to al qaeda.

text: Hidden costs, last minute fees, incomplete service, and deceptively worded offers are what you will find. What ever the offered price expect to pay 20% more in the end when you shop here.

resp.text:
We are incredibly sorry that you did not receive the highest standard of customer care while dealing with us as a company. We strive to offer excellent customer service in all aspects of the purchasing process. While we do our very best to explain everything in detail, we do understand that from time to time there can be miscommunication between ourselves and the customer, and for this we are sincerely sorry. It is never our intention to mislead anyone in our advertisements and we do apologize that this was the impression that you received while doing business with us.
We would appreciate an opportunity to address your complaints, directly. Please stop in or call our Store Manager, Bill Brownell at (256) 383-2888. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: Brittney E
text: I took my Escalade to the service dept to get work done on it. They miss diagnosed it and I paid over $500.00 for repair. I had my truck 2 days before it started doing the same thing again. I called to let them know and got the vehicle back over to them. They had my truck a little over a week and claim it was not doing anything for them and that it was old codes showing up. Well since I have had my vehicle back it once again started doing the same thing showing up the same codes. I decided to take it to another dealership and to my surprise the codes that they told me was old was not old they just cleared them instead of fixing my truck. I'm very upset because they repeatedly lied to me over and over. I will not recommend the service dept at all. They just played around with my truck and I called to let Myla know that it was doing the same thing again and that I took it to another dealership and they showed me how codes had been cleared and showed me the history codes. She stated Christian the service manager would call me but he never did.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. I am very sorry your experience wasn’t what you’d hoped. I have reached out to management to let them know about your recent experience. Someone will be in contact soon.

Before leaving me with my new car, he explained again how to use the features in the car.  In closing, it is obvious that Rodney enjoys selling cars and making his customers happy.

resp.text: Thank you for your rating! We hope to see you back soon. We appreciate your business and thank you for choosing to be a part of the Joe Bullard family of customers!

text: I purchased a vehicle from this dealership in Jan 2021. I came from out of state to pick up the vehicle and when I arrived found out there was an issue with the vehicle. After waiting for a while we worked out  a fixed for the issues and the dealer said they would send a check to me for the repairs. It took almost two weeks for them to finally send the check to me.  Now over a month after I purchased the vehicle I get a message from my county tag office saying that the dealership didn't pay the Tag fe and I will have to come in and pay it.  If a dealer is not going to pay these fees, they need to let people know so your not waiting until the temporary tags run out.

text:
The service department is the best I've ever encountered. They have gone above and beyond every single time. I'm not a crying person but they've made me cry twice. The good cry. The first time: I assume they saw the toy factory and smashed snacks in the carpet or maybe it was my food covered shirt and crazy hair. Either way, they gave me a note of encouragement that every mom needs sometimes with a gift card for coffee. The second time: I requested a larger loaner vehicle which is apparently hard to come by. Along with my 3 kids, my dad is in a wheelchair and I transport him to/from dialysis and we just all wouldn't fit in the smaller one. They greeted me with a "one tough cookie" box with treats and snacks galore.

They are the nicest people and so accommodating. Add uplifting to that mix. That was this exhausted Mama's gift from heaven.

I can't say enough good things about them. I would buy every vehicle from them a thousand times over just to show my appreciation to their service department. Thanks guys!

name: Veronica Eaton
text: I was due for an oil change for my 2012 Cadillac SRX and received a call from the dealership asking me to schedule an appt. I looked online 1st to schedule, there was an appt. available for the next day. I didn't book it, thinking that maybe the person that called would get credit for service. I called her back, and was informed that it would be a week out for the oil change, fine. I also had a secondary issue of getting an estimate for the liftgate actuator replacement. A week later, I take the car in and wait on it. When it was done, I specifically asked about the actuator and was told that the estimate was the paperwork. It wasn't. I called back today to see when I could have this repaired and  was given another appt. a week out. The moral of the story is that they listed 12 things for "recommended services"  but nothing on what I actually requested. The car could have been repaired 10 days ago if I had been given the info that I requested. Now I'm trying to see if I can get my SRX repaired at another dealership either in Pensacola or Gulf Port.

resp.text: Hi Veronica,  I am very sorry to hear about your recent experiece with us. It is our goal to provide each customer with the best service experience possible. We have passed your feedback along to our General Manager and Serivice Manager. With your feedback we can only improve our processes and provide you with the best experience possible.

I walked out of that dealership with an uplifted spirit and felt through the whole process that I was receiving amazing fellowship and as if I were being edified through this whole process. name: Douglas Allen
text: What started off as a beautiful experience has turned out to be a nightmare. I purchased what was told to me to be my Certified 2015 Chevrolet Suburban LTZ. Rodney Lofton who is a awesome salesman and Roseevelt Harris the phenomenal finance guy sold me the vehicle and 3mths into my purchased I was told I had over $2k worth of repairs including brakes, new radiator, tune-up, oil cooler lines, and left tie rod end just to name a few. When I asked why wasn't these things serviced and replaced before I purchased the vehicle I was told the repairs wasn't necessary at the time. I feel the salesman did a great job but the service department made it a bad purchase by not doing their job!! I had to pay for the replacement of the radiator and oil cooling lines but the other repairs are still needed. I feel robbed and will probably never purchase from a major dealership like Joe Bullard again!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Allen,

Thank you for taking the time to give us this feedback. To make sure this issue is addressed/resolved I have notified the General Manager, Jason Colbert, of the situation and asked that he reached out to you as soon as possible today.

I'm very sorry that your service experience did not mirror your sales experience at our store but I'm confident if there's a way to rectify the issue our team will do so.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M., Marketing Manager

name: Robert Werning
text:
Review of Joe Bullard dealership

My used car purchase was probably a little different than most.  In my case, I needed a good, reliable vehicle as quickly as possible and would immediately be making a 12 hour road trip to a different state as soon as the car was in my possession!  My salesman Curtis Williams showed me what I wanted to see, took the time to answer my questions, and gave me the time to decide if the car was right for me - no "pressure to buy" involved.

Curtis actually delivered the car personally the next day, so that I did not have make another 2 hour trip from Pensacola to Mobile and back to pick up the car!
Overall I would say that I am very satisfied with the service I received at this dealership.  If all their employees are as conscientious as the ones that I dealt with I would not hesitate to recommend this dealer.

Respect and kindness are almost a lost value in todays society, but to us they are still important, Troy exemplifies these and more in how he serves his customers,
We were  surprised to hear Christian music playing and to hear the testimonies of several of the staff. We thank them for their standing up for the American values and showing that they are truly a family doing business in an honorable way.
Troy, we have put you and your new Bride on our pray list and thank you for not making fun of us older folks that haven't embraced " this tech -infested" world  fully yet.
We will see you this coming week with more ? and to drop off the keys.

From the moment I entered the doors I was greeted and treated as a lifelong customer.  After meeting with Mr. Jackson I was introduce to Mr. Curtis Williams who would be my salesman.

Mr. Williams and I sat down to discuss what I was looking for in the vehicle of my my choice.  Once I had selected the vehicle, Mr. Williams made the test drive a pleasant and unique experience.  After I decided that this was the vehicle that i wanted, he even saw to it that the reasonable minor imperfections that I nit-picked while looking over the vehicle were taken care of prior to my picking up the vehicle.  Negotiating the final price was even an enjoyable experience, which is rare.  I think that at the end of the day we were both happy with the price.  At no time during the experience did I feel pressured or uneasy.

I will highly recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a new or used vehicle, visit Joe Bullock Cadillac and ask for Mr. Curtis Williams.

Willie Johnson

name: Matt Holloway
text: Terrible! I came in because I had a tail light out and it's one of the newer LED lights that aren't supposed to burn out. They told me to come in at 3 and I would be out by 4. At 4 they had just finished their diagnostic check and they told me it would cost $607 to replace my tail light. I told them to go ahead even though I believed it was too pricey. The rep told me the light costs $500+ and the labor wasnt that much. I started to look up the part online brand new and I could buy 2 for less than what he quoted me. I told him they could stop and I'll bring in the light myself after buying it cheaper elsewhere. He tells me I will still have to pay $135 for the diagnostic. No problem. He comes back and tells me it's already in. I ask well where is my car? He says they're finishing up. 45 minutes later he comes back and tells me that they put a new light in and it didnt work. Must be a wiring issue he said. So I said: "So that $135 diagnostic u tried to charge me for wasn't even accurate? Because the diagnostic claimed I needed a new light." He never did answer. They did change my oil so I paid for my oil change only and went to leave. When I got my car back if was filthy even though they claimed all customers get a complimentary wash with all services. I will never go there again.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback. I assure you this is not the Bullard experience we want for our clients.

I have forwarded your comments to the Service Manager, Sean Alexander, as well as the General Manager so that this can be addressed. I’ve also asked for one of them
to contact you to personally discuss in more detail.

I’m sincerely sorry for how your visit with us needed and I hope that we will be able to earn back your business.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.

name: Julie A
text:
Our family was on vacation in Mobile Alabama this past week. Things didn't go quite as we had planned. Our SUV was cutting out pretty bad on the highway. It was getting worse the closer we got to Mobile. I contacted my friend who's daughter lives in Mobile to see if she might know of a service place. I talked with her daughter and she informed me that her husband, Kyle, worked for Joe Bullard Cadillac. She gave me the number for the service department and said to speak with Haley.  About this time the check engine light came on in our vehicle. It was flashing on and off, then would stay lit.
When I spoke with Haley in the service department she asked about the service engine light. When I told her it had been flashing intermittently she was immediately concerned and said we should get stopped as quickly as we could to avoid internal engine damage.  She then helped us get started with finding a tow service. We were 50 miles aWay and had four people so their usual towing service couldn't do it, but she got the ball rolling for us. She gave me her direct phone number so I could call if I needed anything.
Once we got to the dealership Kyle helped us get a loaner car while ours was being repaired. Haley kept us informed as they learned what was wrong. Our technician, Mike, came in on Saturday to work on our vehicle because we needed to leave to head back to Missouri on Sunday.
To make a long story short...God used all of these people to help us during a difficult time. They made this experience so much less stressful than it could've been. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND TO HELP US! And, they did it all with a smile. We appreciate the dealership and all the individuals who helped get us back on the road. I would recommend them to anyone who needs service or a new ride!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We always strive to meet the needs of our customers no matter the situation. Feel free to let us know if you have any concerns about your vehicle.

Kind regards,
Robby Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

text: My husband and I were so appreciative of the staff at Joe Bullard Cadillac ! We were met by the GM and sales staff who listened thoughtfully to our specific needs. We never felt we were being forced in a direction but rather we felt they used their knowledge and expertise to tailor a “fit” for every area from the car itself to the financing. Special thanks to Damos and Roosevelt! We are confident that our future as part of the JB family is going to be as enjoyable as our purchase of our new car!

resp.text:
Thank you for the excellent review! It is great to know that Damos and Roosevelt were able to provide you with a pressure-free and knowledgeable service. Please feel free to call or stop by if there is anything else we can do to help you. Welcome to the family! Until next time, happy driving!

Best,
Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: James Smith
text: The recent lease of a XT5 is the 3rd Cadillac I have leased from Joe Bullard in last six years. Richard Borden has been instrumental in all three insuring that I got just what I wanted. I have been completely satisfied with the process in closing the deal on all three cars. A big part of each deal was because of Richard. He is the best. On the current lease, Roosevelt Harris and Damos Brand also were great.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for this wonderful feedback, James! We're so glad you came back to see us for your new XT5. It's fantastic to know Richard, Roosevelt, and Damos all helped make us worth the trip in! If there's anything else we can help you with in regards to your new vehicle, please let us know. Happy driving!

Best,
Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: Tracy Williams
text: the service I received on 2/1-2/5/18 has restored my faith in this wonderful dealership. Joe Bullard is the best from sales associate to service to the drivers they employ. Respectful and professional.

name: Pam B
text: I bought a Cadillac SRX from Joe Bullard in Mobile, Al. This dealership, especially Brandon and Andrew were super nice and helpful. Brandon kept me up to date on the on the schedule of getting my vehicle to me since it was being transferred from out of state. Great Dealership.

resp.text: Pam, thank you for the feedback! We are happy to hear of your positive experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac, and we are grateful you chose us for your automotive needs. We look forward to serving you again in the future!  Sincerely, Marc Heiter - General Manager

text: This was the best experience I have EVER had purchasing a vehicle! We went in, after work, on a Friday night. We kept the staff late, which is inconsiderate considering their long days...... Dean and Jon were absolutely wonderful! Thank you for providing your customers with a very friendly and extremely efficient staff!

text: I think that between the service Advisor Vicki Bodet and Repair tech Chase I got a good ofunderstanding of why it took longer to replace the signal bulb. good job

name: Jason Salvage
text: I took my Cadillac CTS into the dealership for an issue of my car not cutting off. I called after a day and they still didn’t know what was wrong. I picked it up and took it to another reliable mechanic and he diagnosed it immediately. I won’t use Joe Bullard anymore.

Hi Jason,

Thank you for this honest feedback. I'm passing this along to the Service Manager as well as the General Manager to make sure they are aware. One of them may reach out to you for information so we can address the issue..

I'm sorry we could not take care of this for you but I do hope we'll have the chance to earn your business again sometime in the future.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.
Marketing and PR Manager

name: Jerry Stewart
text:
Curtis (Salesman) was on top of things.  He was eager to help, and knowledgeable when answering our questions.  He was able to ensure our happiness with the purchase of our Cadillac.

Richard (Finance Mgr) made our financial transaction an easy one.  He was clear & precise on explanations of the paperwork.  Mr. Nassar took his time when necessary, but expedited the purchase process efficiently.

Thanks to both Curtis Williams & Richard Nassar, we are now enjoying our Cadillac from Joe Bullard Automotive.  Thanks!

name: D Paolini
text: Joe Bullard has always extended Care, kindness and consideration in both sales and service. The level of quality from his dealership is consistant reliability. This family value continues to gain our trust and is always appreciated and welcome in ours.

resp.text: D, thank you for sharing your feedback! It is very important to our dealership that we earn the trust of our guests by following through with our promises and providing a hassle-free service. Best, Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: MamaJama71
text:
Great experience, very happy!

We came to the dealership to look for a car for my daughter.  Roosevelt Harris was absolutely the best person I have ever bought a car from, hands down!!  You have a real gem in him as an employee.  Polite, friendly and personable.  A pure please to be around!!!  Jon McCartney helped with my paperwork.  He was beyond a pleasure as well.  I told him I was in a hurry and he was very efficient.  Explained everything very well to me and got my paper work printed up.  I really appreciated how efficient and thorough he was.  He is definitely an asset to your company!

I never felt like they were pushy or anything.  They made me feel welcome.  My teenage daughter thinks Roosevelt is so cool.  He took time with her and answered all her questions.  She said he made her feel important and not just like a kid that didn't matter.  She said when she graduates from college and gets her next car, she's buying it from Mr. Roosevelt, he's like family to her now :)

I hope you can let them know how much we appreciate them and please do something extra special for Roosevelt (my daughter's request).

Thanks!

name: Wayne Howarth
text: I've been a customer of Joe Bullard's since 2014, all sales and service have been exceptional including this sales experience, kudo's to AJ, he was a great help in all questions and issues with the XT5 I am currently purchasing, I have and will recommend your dealership to friends and family, Thanks again, Wayne Howarth

name: wayne coaker
text: Our Salesman Richard Borden was very friendly and helpful in helping us purchase our car, went out of his way on  answering a lot of questions we had in making our decision. We really felt special when the sales manager came in along with Ty Bullard to talk to us and thank us for buying a car from them. We were treated well by everyone involved in our purchase.

Allen answered all of my questions and made the process very easy. I appreciate Allen and the entire Joe Bullard staff’s desire to make sure I was completely satisfied with my purchase.  I am glad I came by to check out their preowned vehicles. I can highly recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac and salesperson Allen Jones to all who would be interested in purchasing a new or used car.

text:

My second visit on May 29th, 2019 resulted in my purchasing a XT4 and everything was totally different. I appreciate the salesman, Sim as well as the business manager Thomas for their help in making tis purchase happen.

text: From the moment I arrived on the Joe Bullard Campus, I was greeted with the respect and sincerity one can only appreciate in the car purchase experience. Within myself I had concluded "You are just looking today!" However, after having Curtis explain in detail the benefits and details on my car, and how it was "built to go head-to-head with the world's best", I knew I couldn't let this opportunity pass me by.  Mr. Williams is a "people person", and this will take him very far in his endeavers to maximize the car buyer's experience.  I have not regretted my purchase in any capacity, and have been singing the praises of the Joe Bullard Team - especially Curtis Williams!!!

Working with Allen Williams and Roosevelt Harris made, what for us was a stressful event (purchasing a new vehicle), into an enjoyable experience for my wife and I. text: Got a CTS... Staff is very polite & courteous.  Will come back for another vehicle when I plan on purchasing one.  Staff will work with you to the best that they can.

name: Jami Morgan
text: The people in the service department handling my claim were very nice. What I didn't like was that the mechanics were excessively rough with my vehicle. I had to have it towed and the towing company left it at the gate. Christian got me a loaner car, which I appreciated very much. When I picked up the loaner there were 2 guys who were trying to get it started to get it up to the shop. I needed to grab a couple things out of my car so I stopped to do that. For some reason they needed to open the back hatch. I was traveling with my animals so I had a large kennel in the back. I watched them put my seats down (rather roughly) and sling my kennel from the back to atop the back seats. It made me cringe but at this point I needed to get going as I had some stops to make and  I thought surely they knew what they were doing, this is a Cadillac dealership afterall and these cars cost a lot. They will surely be careful... When I got my car back, instead of them putting the vehicle back they way they found it, the kennel was still strown across the back. (As a plus though, it was washed! Which I appreciated since I had been on the road and try to take care of my car!) When I went to move the kennel back in place I noticed that there are scrapes across the plastic sides in the back. Greeeeaaaaaat. But, at that point I was leaving to head back to my home state and couldn't worry about it. It was more important to get home safe. They told me in addition to the battery that I needed new air filters, a rear wiper blade, and the throttle body cleaned, all easy enough for me to do myself. So, now I am here doing said maintenance and when I popped the hood I immediately noticed that my positive battery terminal clip has been broken and won't stay shut. Great. I am now back home, 3 states away. I will be back to the area, and am considering moving my family there but if they don't make this right I will find a different dealership to maintenance at.

resp.text:
Hi Jami,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review and detailed feedback. We are closed today; however, I’m sending your comments over to my General Manager and Service Manager to make sure they address this first thing in the morning. Please expect a call from us tomorrow. I’m very sorry for your experience and I hope we have the opportunity to prove to you this is not how do business nor is this how we want our customers to feel when they leave our dealership.

Sincerely,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

name: Frank Jones
text: This was the best car shopping experience that I have ever had, if it was ten stars they would get it from me.  It started with my Internet Sales Manger Tundy McDonald and she was very excellent  getting ideas and question to help me with the purchase of my 2016 Escalade ESV. She sent me to my saleslady Courtney Mauldin, asks for her when you come in, she was totally Awesome. She went above and beyond to get a deal worked out for me,  there was an issue with the car and she took it straight to  service and they fixed it right away and found something else and ordered the part and sent it to detail to get it clean up and they did a great job. If you are looking to purchase a vehicle I recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, who will treat you right, quick in and out, and they are Veteran friendly, great staff and service. It was worth the 285 miles that I drove from Louisiana to get an awesome deal and meet some great people that really cared about my shopping experience. Ms. Courtney  called me on Monday to check on me to make sure everything was alright with me and the Escalade, and that is quality service at it fineness.

resp.text:
Wow, your kind words took our breath away! We are so glad your recent visit was such a success, and we hope you won’t hesitate to reach out again in the future.

Take Care,
Robert Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

name: Bill McLarty
text: I am William, answering for my wife Cheryl.  We bought this car new in 2004.  It has been solely serviced and maintained by McConnel/Bullard.  It has less than 30,000 miles on the odometer.  It's been the worst car we've owned since our marriage in 1962.  The problem today was a broken window regulator on the rear driver's side.  My wife has been the sole driver of this car.  We have no children in then home.  My conservative guess is that this window has been lowered and raised no more than 10 times in its aborted lifetime.  My wife was told a plastic roller had broken.  A plastic roller in a $50,000 (2004) Cadillac?!  My bill:  $517.23!  I can go back through my invoices and find similar instances of shoddy work and padded bills.  During the second year we owned the car the driver side dash assembly fell off the dash while my wife was driving.  At around the 4-5 year of ownership your service supervisor convinced my wife that she needed to replace all four tires (around 10,000 miles) because they had "dry-rotted." ($800)  I've owned two Cadillac De Ville's prior to this, and have never experienced what has to be either poor construction, low-quality parts, or untruthful service managers.

name: KIM CARTER
text:
Awesome Customer Service!!!

I recently purchased a 2011 Cadillac SRX. The customer service provided by all the staff at Joe Bullard exceeded my expectaions. I had the pleasure of working with Darren Robinson (New/Used Car Sales) and he most definitely went above and beyond to ensure I was a satisfied customer. Thanks for taking the hassle out of buying a car!!!

text: Our saleswoman Courtney was amazing and genuine. We received grade A customer service every step!

name: myra howard
text: Will never purchase another used vehicle that's not made by  Cadillac. My son purchased me a Lexus GX 470 after it was traded in. I had a total of six loaner cars from the date of purchase . Never Ever will they get a dime or another referral from me. I wish they had a half star. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

name: barbara cowan
text: Saw a vehicle being advertised on Autotrader website that I was interested in. Before I made my visit to the lot, my mind was set that I would only be going to look at the vehicle. I was not even planning on test driving. But Mustafa Elastal (Moose) was so friendly and laid back, he made me feel very welcomed and comfortable.  All my questions and concerns was addressed with expertise and professionalism. Not once did I ever feel pressured. After a test drive and feeling this the vehicle I wanted, I told him I will be getting back with him. After conversing on and off for about a month with Moose the salesman by phone and having the privilege to speak directly to Ty (the owner of the dealership)  I felt the dealership really wanted my business and cared about my satisfaction.The deal was made by phone. Vehicle was delivered to my home personally by my salesman. All transactions and paperwork done in the comfort of my home. I was very impressed with the way I was treated during my recent buying experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Would definitely recommend family and friends.

name: Jenny Linda
text: Bought a 2009 GMC Yukon used from this dealership. Great service, very friendly and helpful. Scott Howie was very accomodating in trying to make sure I got the truck I was looking for and was very helpful. Mr. Richard Nassar knew I was on my lunch break and worked very quickly to get me in and out and finished with all my paperwork all with a smile on his face. Went to many other dealerships in the search for this used truck and could not be more pleased with my experience here at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Will start here first next time and leave the rest for last resort!!!

name: Jeannette Bennett
text: Worst used vehicle I've ever purchased. This car has cost more in 18 months than my Honda in ten years. Inspection protocol was incomplete before the car was presented for sale. When I tried to find out what had been done I received this asinine answer: if it needed something we did it. Will never purchase a car here again.

Our GM, Marc Heiter will be reaching out to you shortly regarding this matter. Sincerely, Joe Bullard Cadillac Team

name: Johnny Swopes
text: Absolutely, the most wonderful buying experience my wife Kathy and I have ever had.  The atmosphere was amazing!!  Ty was very gracious and made us feel so welcome as did the entire Bullard family!! Andrew Speight was phenomenal with his delightful British accent describing all of the wonderful details of this truly great Cadillac DTS. His knowledge of the vehicle was paramount!! He knew 'everything' and treated us royally with the test driving and description of the many facets of the vehicle. Andrew kept everything in perspective of the price we could afford. Then he turned us over to Jon McCarthy who was equally as brilliant. Jon made it happen!!! What service!! Jon was so relatable with such tenacity in helping us, and he really came through with making our dream come true!! We highly recommend the family of Joe Bullard Cadillac, and especially Andrew Speight and Jon McCarthy.  They will indeed spoil you! We really thank the Lord for sending us to this Company, thy are a true blessing to the gulf coast!!

name: C C Hall
text: I purchased a Cadillac SRX on 1/11/14 from Joe Bullard Cadillac. Curtis, Roosevelt and Ty were very courteous to me and my husband. They answered all of my questions and worked with us to get to the price we were willing to pay. The Cadillac warranty is hard to beat, especially the 4 years of maintenance and the road side assistance. This is the 6th GM vehicle that we presently own and I know will be the best serviced one by far. I had been looking for a vehicle for 5 months when I decided to look at the SRX. I am glad I did. It has everything on it that I was looking for plus a lot or more features. Everyone at the dealership that walked by you spoke and asked you how you were doing. This is a dream vehicle for me and I look forward to driving it for years. I will recommend to family and friends that are interested in a great luxury car or SUV to get a Cadillac at Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, Alabama and ask for Curtis. I had to use the service department today to get my oil changed and check the routine things out. Christian and the others were very courteous and took care of me and my SRX. The customer lounge area was very pleasant and comfortable during my wait.

name: Greg Loughlin
text: Good workmanship, poor communication.  No warranty info with tires on road hazzard option.

Please feel free to contact us any time you need assistance and we hope to continue working with you in the future.
