text: Almost everything i buy has a limited lifetime warranty. Best auto parts store imo

name: Adam Benson
text: To bree k. On your story about what took place. The vehicle in question was brought in because the ignition switch was defective. Due to the connector going to the anti-theft module was not making connection. After I spent 30 minutes on the phone with the chevy dealer I found the connector was not available. I instructed your daughter to go and get a complete unit with a new pig tail. After explaining to them that a code reading would bring no results to identify the issue. I did allow the vehicle to sit in my parking lot until the problem could be addressed. Most places charge several hundred dollars to do this. Several days later they brought in a switch from a junk yard that was ripped out and badly damaged. I told them they could not use part due to being damaged. After a couple days a night time worker offered to help with diagnostics, he brought his scan tool and tried to diagnosis the issue. Found the anti-theft module was not making any connection with the vehicles pcm. He spent over an hour trying to help your daughter for free. He normally charges $70 an hour for this. We have gone out of our way to help your daughter every way we could. Including letting the vehicle sit for over a week. No way did your stand out in the cold while we laughed at her. If you feel we miss treated you I am the store manager my name is Adam Benson and feel free to come by and we can discuss this situation.

name: David Winslett
text: Went in to get a replacement antenna for my car March 3rd 2021! When I went to check out the guy at the register was talking to a guy who just walked in and asked where the wheel covers were and he walked over a showed him! Instead of coming back to check me out he stood there talking when I ask him to check me out he ignored me and kept talking. This guy looked like a school kid and was very rude! I will not be going to the Sylacauga store again! I'll go to Cbu e.g. or take my business to another parts store!

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, David. We'd appreciate it if you emailed us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience and get back on track. We want to make sure all of our customers feel welcome and valued at our store, and it seems like we let you down. We hope you give us another chance to provide a great customer experience.

name: Rachel Lee
text:
Gave an extra start because whoever answered the phone had the decency to accept fault for an issue, and was polite.

Placed order online, and received an email that the order is ready for pickup. So, I drove from C'burg (past the AutoZone that said they are out of stock online) to Sylacauga, only to be told that the parts I ordered were not in stock, despite the notification that they WERE in stock.

Rather than calling me and letting me know, they issued a refund. Refund will take 3 to 5 business days to hit my card. I'm down to a couple dollars in the bank, I used my last bit of money for parts to fix a car for work.

Had they actually called me and let me know it's not in stock and not to make the drive, I would have requested they order the parts and I'd come pick them up tomorrow. But now, I'm broke for the next week. I can't even order the parts.

Please, PLEASE Autozone, next time this happens to someone, call them IMMEDIATELY and let them know, and ask them if they'd prefer a refund or to order the parts. Your customer should decide what should be done with their money.

resp.text: We're sorry for the inconvenience, Rachel. Professionalism is a priority for us, so we're sorry we weren't able to let you know. We strive to keep our stores well-stocked with a wide selection of products to support your automotive needs and get you back on the road. We're continuously improving and we hope you check us out again.

name: Austin Boston
text: Worst experience I’ve ever had in my life!! To begin with the Hoover store gave us the completely wrong part. We stop at the store in Calera to get the correct part. The manager Derrick was snarky and rude. Told us we bought “cheap brakes” and needed to buy the $64 ones instead. Then I try to just try to return. There was a customer in front of me taking a while and offered to let me go ahead. The worker refused. Then when it was my turn, I tried to return the brakes. The worker spent time trying to look up the part just to reiterate that it was the wrong part. I told him I wasn’t even purchasing new brakes, just returning those. I told him at least 10 times I bought it from Hoover. 5 minutes later he refused to return the wrong part because I didn’t purchase it at his store and stated “I wish you told me that sooner”. Too bad you can’t give a 0 Star review.

text:
I would not recommend this store to my worst enemy.  I am from out of town and I had my brake lights malfunction.  I stopped at this store to see if they could help me out and what I got was NOTHING.  I didn't expect them to fix it or even look at it.  I just needed some direction and what I got was a "we can't help you".  I went down the street to NAPA auto parts where the guy working in there checked my fuse for me and replaced it for me.  Advance needs to take some customer service lessons from NAPA.
I very rarely write negative reviews for retail businesses because I worked in retail management for years and I understand that things happen but this was beyond rude and I will always use NAPA going forward.

text:
I went to get my battery recharged or replaced. I pulled up and waited 10 minutes and then was waived off by the only employee in the bay working.

After someone finally came out to check, they said that my 5-year warranty on my battery was actually only good for 3 years and then they give your a credit towards a new battery for whatever is left of the last 2 years. I get it if that was the policy, but just very crummy that it wasn’t explained that way when I purchased and false advertising on the battery as it explicitly says “5-year Warranty”. Luckily the battery could be recharged after an hour.

The mechanic mentioned it was from over tightening parts (cracked the oil sending unit) during the oil chance (since we didn't have the oil leak before).

name: Stacy Beardslee
text: My tire light went on literally 2 minutes before pulling in to this ACC. I had driven through an accident 10 minutes before and knew this had meant that I had run over something. I live an hour away and wanted to find out if there was anything they could help me with it, I knew it was close to closing (about 15 minutes till) but my child was in the car and I wanted to make sure we'd make it back home safely. I tried to explain this to the man out in the shop (I was approached before I could even get out of the car) but he kept interrupting me stating that they were closing and trying to finish up on the car they were currently working on. All I wanted at the least was someone with a little knowledge to look at my tire and give me a recommendation/ opinion as to what my options would be. I understand that everyone wants to go home when their scheduled to, but come on! I just wanted to make sure I could make it home with my child safely!

name: Marcus Ross
text: Awful customer service. Very disrespectful. Extremely unorganized staff. Wish I could give them no stars. I called and asked for 2 tires for my car, they gave me the total price for both being installed for $155.16 before taxes. I told them let's do it and to order the tires. They called me back a few hours later telling me the tires were in. I drove 30 minutes down 280 for the tires. I pulled up and they told me they would get me right in and taken cared of. I went inside for a few minutes and saw my car was up on the lift, I waited for about 15-20 minutes and noticed my car was out of the shop, so I asked them if it was finished, and waited and waited and waited, and after talking to three different people it turned out they didn't do anything to the car at all. They just pulled it into the shop lifted it up, and then lowered it and pulled it out, and never relayed the information about why they did this. When I finally got someone to talk to the guys, they said that they didn't have the tires I ordered, and I told them that they had called me and told me they did and that I have a voicemail from them stating that they did, and I played the voicemail for them, and then talked to the guy directly that left me the voicemail. So, they go and look and turns out they do have the tires after all. They pull my car back in and put the tires on, then ring me up for $211.00, and I'm like, "I'm not paying that", then I have to talk to the manager that's "running" the shop, and finally after 3 hours I get the price they told me, thank goodness I had the voicemail from them for proof, and I got out. Never. Going. Back. Maybe the most unprofessional atmosphere and experience I've ever had with a business. Truly disappointing in every way. They were also very rude to the other customers that were waiting patiently as well. They would blatantly ignore you when you'd approach them with a question about your vehicle or the situation they were putting you in. Just straight up walk past you and not say a word to you or look you in the eyes. If and when they finally did talk to you, they just mumbled their words and you couldn't understand a thing they were saying. They need to clean house, get rid of the manager and all. If not that, then just do the entire state of Alabama a favor and close up shop completely, because you're not doing any good for anyone. Like, you're not even doing your jobs, like at all. Since I left, I've actually been wondering "what's even the point of this shop"? The guys are all just hanging out. Finally the guy that did put the tires on my car was just some dude, that wasn't even in a uniform like the rest of the automotive crew was. He was just in some shirt and ball cap with sun glasses, so I'd at least like to thank the random guy that probably doesn't even work there that actually did the work. Maybe he was an angel or something....? If it turns out he is an actual angel and it's some kind of real miracle, it's still not worth going back for.

text: The price is the best you can find... But you get what you pay for. The staff is very inefficient. There is usually about one car in the bay and they will tell you it’s going to be an hour and a half.  If you don’t mind wasting your time in saving the money I guess it’s worth it.

name: Wil Johnson
text:
Horrible staff.
Manager was nice but guys working it stink. Was told they would get me in as long as I got there before 7:00pm and I got there at 6:45pm. They close at 8. I drove 20 minutes on a spare tire only to have them rudely just repeat themselves saying “we’re closed” “we’re closed”. Wouldn’t even listen to me trying to explain my situation and that they told me on the phone they would service me if I got there before 7. He just walked off while I was talking and I had to follow him inside. Only once I asked to speak to the manager did he explain it was because they were full and wouldn’t finish before 8. I asked them to please help me out as my wife had to get to work tomorrow and my spare tire was going flat. They were no help so I went to NTB tires down the street and they quickly took care of me. Walmart you lost a customer from your horrible service. I had always previously used you, but no longer.

text: I bought my truck bed cover from these guys. At one point it broke. these guys fixed it very quickly and made it as easy as possible for me. Couldn't recommend them enough

name: Gabble G Girl Snell
text: I was very impressed by the dedication of the staff. I took my Toyota Tacoma truck by to have them add the electrical plug for my trailer hitch. They went over it and said there were two types. They ordered one, but when it came in, it wasn’t the right one. I was very impressed by their honesty in telling me the truth. They apologized and said they would be glad to get the right one if I would allow them. While they were evaluating it though, they discovered that the trailer hitch was not properly mounted. I watched them fix it, and they didn’t charge me for fixing it. They installed the right one the next day and I was very satisfied. Thanks Clint and crew.

name: Wesley Hall
text: I am highly disappointed with H and H as a whole... I called and set up an appointment through corporate to have a hitch and wiring harness installed on our Jeep Oatriot. The gadsden store was closest to me. Christian tried to set me up an 8:00 a:m appt. but I could not make it so he set me up for 10:30 a:m.... I clarified that these items were in stock at the store. He said yes they are... so I call this morning at 8:30 a:m this morning to verify my appt... I get a call at 9:30 telling me that oops, we don’t have your parts here and are waiting on them to come in on our truck!!! They should be here about 11:30 or so!!!!!!!!!! I took of work  for half a day to have this installed... now it’s gonna cost me a whole day... why make an appt if this is how you are treated? It’s crazy and very frustrating!!! As well as costly....to lose a whole day of work

resp.text: Wesley, we do sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. H&H has discounted your purchase and hopes you will give us another chance in the future!

text: I visited your store & was impressed with the helpful employees, the products & will visit often.  I recommend your store to any person that needs truck or pool products.

text: Talethia really went above and beyond to take care of me. Really needed new brakes and rotors. Very pleased with the quick turn around time and reasonable pricing. Will be back 😀

name: Chloe Photography
text:
Never been happier! Eugene has very good customer service and took care of all of my needs plus some! Thank you so much! Highly recommend

**UPDATE: A couple days after leaving the shop I noticed the brakes seemed to be sticking some. I chopped it up to new brakes and rotors. 2 months after service and every time I get on the freeway my tires shake and when I brake after getting off the exit the shaking is horrible, brakes jump and pulsate. I have pulled over twice this week to see if I see any issues and have noticed smoke coming from my brake pad area. I will never use this place again. Now I have to Fix the brakes and rotors I just got. Not to mention I was conned I to getting some kind of contract deal at a good price. Come to find out I was mislead and instead of paying $1038.00 through monthly payments. I have to pay a total of $2500 through weekly payments. All I wanted was brakes and rotors and had cash on hand but was talked into tires and some more things that “I needed”

resp.text: Hello Chloe, we could not locate any information in our system for you. When you get a moment, you can contact our consumer solutions department at 914-984-2500 option #2 referencing your ticket number 0500-539009.

text: Manager seemed aloof and detached...Did not appear to go the extra mile for customer satisfaction. Changed more for service rendered than what was quoted by appointment staff

text: Absolutely terrible service! A women set up an appointment for me to come on Thursday at 8am to get tires. Only for them to turn me around and tell me that they do not make appointments before the tires are there. (I was informed over the phone that my tires would be there on Wednesday.) The man told me the tires would be there at 1pm. 1o’clock turn into 3 o’clock I called them back and still no tires. I received a callback around 4:30 tell me the truck came however my tires wasn’t on the truck. They found my tires at another location and said they will would put them on the next day. If you have the tires I need at one of your other locations why didn’t you go get them or send me to your other location. The man who called me back the last time did not seem remorseful and did not apologize for wasting my entire day.

resp.text: We apologize, Danielle When you get a moment, you can contact our consumer solutions department at 914-984-2500 option #2 and we would be happy to assist you. .

When i brought them in they werent making ANY noise as soon as i let them do them and rotors they are sqealing and grinding! I kept taking them back for them to replace them but they say they didnt hear anything so they didn't feel the need to replace them. Smh less than a yr later i had to get someone else to do them CORRECTLY

resp.text: We're sorry, Brittany Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

name: Adam King
text: I had put my spare on after finding a flat when I left work for the day. Tire shops were closed or closing soon and I didn't want to ride my spare on the interstate home, so I called ahead and asked if Mavis could work me in. They agreed and I was really grateful to have them work late to help me out. They were very positive and upbeat. They fixed the tire. It made a difference in my day. I'll start here the next time I need tire service.

resp.text: Thank you, Adam King. we believe you deserve nothing short of the best. We truly thank you for being a valued customer!

text: 12/15/2020 Great service. The staff and management is AWESOME! Eugene always make sure I am pleased with the service.!!!

name: Alex Quick
text: The staff here always go above and beyond for me. I got a new set of tires and a new battery many months ago. The staff and value really impressed me so I've continued to go back for basic services. This time I had a nail in one of the tires that was too far outside to be patched. Talethia helped me out this time and she helped me get my tire replaced with my warrenty and get back to studying for finals in under an hour. I really love this place and their team.

name: Roger Bowers
text: For routine service, got right in and out, professional work, courteous, fairly priced.  What more could I ask for?  For the record, I had some abnormal wear on a set of tires I purchased from them 2 years ago, and they gave me a new set prorated with a very generous allowance.  All my interactions with them have been positive, even for out-of-state needs.

name: Andrea Mullins
text: When we moved to our current location a few years ago we discovered Mavis. My tires kept losing air so I was going in often asking them to put air in my tires. They were always nice and willing to help. They have repaired tires several times and provided other service as well. I have always been pleased.

resp.text: Thank you, Andrea We at Mavis believe you deserve nothing short of the best. Thank you for the great rating! We promise to continue to deliver you 5 star service.

name: Clinton Mann
text: I have used this location before and have been pleased, but never again. I brought my truck in for brakes and it was a complete disaster. The truck squealed and ground the whole time I drove after the brake job. It was way worse than before I brought it in. After 3 return visits to the shop I was told they didn't have time, or there was no mechanic on site each time. Also I called ahead, or made an appointment in person each time. The last time I was told to be there on Wednesday morning at 8:00 a.m. and they would get me first in line ( since I had already paid for a failed brake job). I arrived and was told once again " no mechanic is on site right now" . I work full time and don't have the time to spend back and forth trying to get it right. I took the truck to a different mavis location and they rectified the problem but I waited for over 3 hours while they did a complete brake job. I was told by the second location that it was not done properly and that the first time the old parts were still in place. They did nothing and charged me 700$. I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry, Clinton Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can learn how to improve for you!

name: Tasty Melts
text: Talethia and Jay were amazing. Quick and sweet and the job was done correctly.

name: jonte arnette
text: When I first walked in the door I was promptly greeted with warm friendly smiles!!!  Eugene and Talethia  both spoke and asked what services best met my needs. They asked questions and were very knowledgeable of the services Mavis provided which was helpful to myself. The customer service here is very excellent and as a first time customer I will be returning no questions asked and I will also make sure to recommend Mavis to all my friends, family and clients  . I’m thrilled to know that I have a place with beautiful customer service and prices you can’t beat to service my vehicles!!!

name: Kiu C
text: Took the car in to repair the tire. The patch failed and tire pressure dropped down to 10 few hours later. Had to put in a can of fix a flat. Took the car in the next day, they told me that my tires are old and needed to be replaced. I had to edit this review that was previously given 5 stars. I was told that if I give them 5 stars on google review, they will give me discount. However, they do have very good customer services.

resp.text: Hello Tsz, our Store Manager recommeded tires but you declined and they assisted you regarding the tire patch. Please advise if we can do anything to change you review to a five star. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2.

name: janet young
text: When I came to Mavis, I knew I needed new brakes and probably new rotors so I had already called around to local mechanics and checked prices.  It was around 4pm Friday afternoon so I had accepted the reality that I would not be able to get the work done at best before the following day.  Not only was I happy with the enthusiastic "can do" "lets make it happen" attitude from Eugene the manager and his entire team, but the price was competitive, and he was able to get it done same day!  As an Uber driver this was extremely helpful because it allowed me to not miss a busy weekend night of work and possibly a whole weekend of work, putting money back in my pocket.  I could not be more grateful to the entire team for taking such great care of me and especially their willingness to take on the repair near the end of the day on a Friday!  I will definitely be back for other auto needs!

name: Eddie Moore
text: Wonderful place. Wonderful people. Meghan was so helpful. We got 4 tires and a full alignment on my Church Transit Van for $300 cheaper than the next best price.

name: Bianca Rapley
text: I had a great experience with Talethia, she fun, respectful, helpful, great attitude. She deserve a raise.

name: Jonathan Snively
text:
I feel like the manager Eugene has conned me. I went in back in April because I needed new brake pads and rotors. After waiting about 5 hours for them to install, it was finally done. About a month or 2 later, my vehicle starts to squeal anytime I apply my brakes. I took it into Goodyear at the beginning of October as the sound was getting unbearable. They checked my brakes and said that the rotors were cheap and needed to be fixed. They suggested me to take my vehicle back to fix the shorty work Mavis did to get warranty work as Mavis said I had a “warranty”. The next day October 3 I took it into Mavis. Sure enough after looking at my car for 30 minutes my calipers were hanging down. I waited another 4 hours for them to put 2 calipers on. Why I paid them another 400 dollars is beyond me. As I was leaving there parking lot my vehicle was squealing when I applied the brakes but it seemed to be better. About a week ago, I noticed my vehicle started to shake and when I backed up it sounded like I had a flat tire. At this point I know I was intentionally being conned out of over 800 dollars from Mavis tire. I take my vehicle to pep boys on Sunday.

My calipers were loose again. They didn’t tighten the damn bolts on the calipers. One caliper bolt was gone. The other one was about to be gone. Could have caused a huge accident. This is a terrible place of business. Eugene has no integrity in my opinion. I want to get my money back.

I called customer service today talked to an answering service. Customer service never called me back. Please avoid this place at every cost.

I have tried to send the picture of the receipt to the gentleman's phone. He asked me to take a picture and text him... Is there an email address I can send this to?

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, we believe accountability is paramount. We apologize for only bringing you 1 star service. This is nowhere near our standard. We see that you have since been in contact with the Regional Manager, Chad who is currently awaiting a receipt to be sent so he can review.

name: Eric L
text:
Appointments literally mean NOTHING at Mavis. My girlfriend made an appointment over the phone over a week in advance. She gets there and they don’t have her tires in. Why you ask? Apparently they have a company policy where if they’ve sat in the shop more than a couple of days they just send them back. Doesn’t matter if you have an appointment or not. Makes zero sense.

I also made an appointment. Wasn’t quite as far in advance. (Couple of days) I did mine online. Guess what happened when I showed up to my appointment. Yup, no tires. Apparently they don’t deliver tires on Tuesdays. If that’s true, why let me book an appointment for Wednesday on a Monday? I did receive a call on Tuesday. The guy just said “we don’t have your tires in yet”. I said “ok? Well my appointment is for tomorrow. Will they be in on time?”. He said “yeah”.

Mavis needs some serious restructuring at both the store and home office level. Avoid this business at all cost. Order from tire rack and ship to another installer. Same price or cheaper.

text: Literally went out of there way to make me feel like family and helped me with any concerns i had from the tire guy to the frontend alignment guy even front desk going out of her way to help me find solutions to any and all my concerns mr Eugene manager thank you for all your help going out of your way to get my tires and your team going out of there way to explain and check for any safty issues strongly recommend homewood store to anyone with car issues they literally go out of there way 10 out of 5 stars for sure i wish i thank all by name i truely am grateful for everyone that i had contact with

text:
Dropped my car off for a front wheel alignment, I was called and informed to get it aligned would take repairs totaling over $1300. I was not going to put this much money in a car this old, so I told them I would not have any work done and would pick the car up later that day. I called ahead later and was told that they closed at 5 pm, and I told the person on the phone I would be there in time.
At 4:50 I arrived to find the entire place closed and locked up, this was a Saturday night and Mavis is closed on Sundays, thus leaving me without a vehicle until Monday.
Also my car was left outside with the doors unlocked, the interior lights turned on, and the battery dead.

Nice! 😎👌

text: Waited for 3 hours for them to fix my front brake pads. Eventually I found out that they didn’t even have the part they needed, which they didn’t bother to tell me until I asked 2 hours into the process. When I asked how much longer it would be, they said they would call their parts guy to find out. They didn’t bother telling me the result of that phone call. I took work off to get this problem fixed, and they wasted half my day with no apology or explanation. Horrible customer service.

name: Steven McCallister
text:
I took my truck in to get the brakes replaced because I am too busy to do it on my own. It also had another problem with the brakes randomly locking up under five mph. They had it on the rack for nothing but three minutes, failed to do what I asked, and failed to even inspect the part I diagnosed to be the problem. They just tried upselling another service.
Took my truck home and fixed the problem myself.
They need more mechanical training, otherwise they will continue to misdiagnose a lot of problems.

text: I am convinced no one at this tire engineers knows what they are doing. We dropped our car off to get 2 new rear tires. We left and the tire pressure sensor was still on so we brought it back and waited 30 mins for them to try to fix it and they said it was fixed and would go off after we drove it 10 miles. We waited 2 days and it never went off so we took it back and had to wait for them to go get new sensors and install them. We wasted so much time for them to try to figure out what they were doing. Don't waste your time and go somewhere else to get tires!

name: Collin Brady
text: I have been dealing with David Vines for the Last 4 months. It took him two and a half months for me to get me my parts. I was very understanding and gave him his time. When I finally got my flywheel it looked like it had spent the last year in the rain AND it was for a manual not an SMG. I shipped the parts back and he told me he would refund me in which I told him to deduct 80$ off the price which was what it cost him to ship to me because I wanted to be fair. It has been 29 days since he RECEIVED the parts and is now ignoring all of my phone calls texts and whenever I call the office he’s “out to lunch” and for the third time has been “dealing with his son in the hospital” I have been told by him “just two more days” for two weeks and then the last week he refuses to answer me at all. David vines is a crook and a scam and do not use his services EVER

The owner DAVID VINES is very racist and unprofessional. I’m honestly shocked their still allowed to operate while
Continuing to swindle people out their money .

My attorney will be sending them a letter and I will see him in court.  Do not do business with them.

text: Buyer BEWARE!  I ordered BMW parts on July 11th.  The parts never came...He said mirror came in shattered and he had to get another one.  After two weeks, I lost the job.  Called to get a refund. When I could get them to answer the phone, I was told that the person that knew how to run the credit card machine wasn't in....I was told repeatedly that I would be called back.  They NEVER called back.  They weren't answering my calls and I was having to call from other numbers.  When I did get the owner, he said he would handle it and call me right back.  Didn't happen.  I am now trying to go through my bank to get my money back.  I paid $575 for parts I never received and now they won't refund me!  TERRIBLE BUSINESS!

text: I ordered a used vanos for a 2004 530i, price was great, service was great.  It showed up to our shop in Houston Texas on time.  It's a shame I cant find this kind of service and readily available used BMW parts here in town.  Thanks Vines, I'll call you guys 1st from now on and save the headache of shopping around.

text: I've been using Vines for parts ever since I've owned BMWs.  They are prompt, fair on prices, and have excellent service.  I will gladly continue to give them my time and money.

text:
This dude David is a real RACIST piece of crap person, I think the word Tension and Engine doesn't sound the same then he claims that he doesn't understand my English, is like his southern accent sound a lot better than mine.
People like this shouldn't be doing business at all until they clean their heart from racism especially they are from ALABAMA.

name: Nicole Bartig
text: If I could give 0 stars, I would, but that is not an option.  On August 6th, a part was purchased, and when it finally showed up, it was the wrong part.  After a long run-around we finally got the part that we needed, but when it was put in the car, it didn't work!  We returned both the first and second parts on October 8th, and we are STILL trying to receive our payment from Ron Vines, and it is APRIL 12th!  We have gotten the run-around from Gary and Robert, who keep telling us  Ron isn't available, or is out for a delivery, blah blah.  We have been trying to call Ron since October, and he refuses to speak to us.  Now when we call, the phone is picked up and then hung up, and we have not received our payment.  All we are asking for is for Vines to pay us what they owe us, but they are refusing. They have stolen our money, and Ron Vines refuses to speak to us to settle this. I will delete this post once our money is returned, but until then...ZERO stars for Vines Automotive.  DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM THEM!!!

name: Dorothy Adams
text: I asked the young gentleman at the Counter if they helped replace headlight bulbs. He said depends on the car- so he came and checked it out. Help me find the bulb that was needed, replaced in no time! He had me check my high beams and low beams- said all four of headlights were working- (it took him a second) though to say that. (That should have been a red flag right then for me).Well I gave him a small tip for helping me out. I went to leave and looking at the lights shining on the door it did not look like all four were working but I had somewhere else to be and was already running behind. I said I would check it out when I got to my next stop- sure enough they were not working. I am mad at myself for not addressing it then! I called back the next morning and talked to the young man and he said “all four were working when you were here.” I explained how the minute he walked away- I didn’t think it was right but it’s my fault for not addressing it right then! I am supposed to stop by and see the manager today— so we shall see what the outcome is! Lesson learned for me!

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Dorothy. It is never our intent to deceive or mislead as we value all our customers. Please send us an email at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can make things right. We hope we can regain your trust and confidence.

text: Just called Madison Blvd location to let them know my limousine was coming in for a battery.  The lady that answered told me not to worry and they will install another.   Great customer service.  I don't remember her name.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback, David! We're happy to hear that our crew helped you out with installing your battery. We always want to make sure we're providing you with excellent customer service. Thanks for trusting AutoZone!

We'd appreciate it if you emailed us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience.

name: Nathaniel Key
text: Convenient, honest, and affordable - There are many different reasons, but I mainly use them due to their employees. The knowledge of their employees is typically a much higher level than what I have experienced at other large chain type automotive parts stores. Instead of just having someone input the make/model/year of my vehicle into their computer system and telling me if they have the part in stock, they ask some intelligent questions about the problem I am experiencing and then help troubleshoot as well as offer advice and sometimes alternative solutions which has saved me money and trouble on multiple occasions. They also offer top quality  products as well. The top notch customer service, along with their selection is what makes me return time and time again.

name: Steve L
text:
I’m really torn about The Car Stereo Shop. On the one hand, Anthony, the sales person who I dealt with, is really nice, helpful, knowledgeable, and wants his customers to be happy. On the other hand, there were so many problems with my install, it just seems like things are really disorganized over there and quality control might be a little lacking.

I went to The Car Stereo Shop because my 2005 car didn’t even have an aux port, and I wanted one. But Anthony then informed me I could get a video head unit which would allow me to use Android Auto like a new car can, and that sounded awesome, so I decided to do that instead of just getting an aux port (I wouldn’t really need the aux port since I’d be able to play music with Bluetooth or USB cord). Also, he suggested a speaker upgrade from factory speakers (without being pushy about it at all), and I realized it would be nice to have non-factory speakers for a change. So I ordered an install of the head unit, speakers, and a new Sirius satellite antenna since the old 2005 one wouldn’t work with the head unit.

Then the problems began. For example:

--When I went to pick up the car after the install, the Sirius satellite antenna had never been installed.
--When i went to pick up the car after the Sirius satellite antenna was installed, the microphone (needed for hands-free phone calls & Android auto commands) no longer worked.
--When I went to pick up the car after the microphone was fixed, I found a small chunk of my dash had been ripped out during the latest repair.
--The Sirius radio kept cutting out, and when I asked them about it they said it was just the trees blocking the signal, but finally I was so frustrated I contacted Sirius and they sent me a replacement antenna, and after replacing the antenna the radio didn’t cut out at all so it turns out I was right.
--Also, there were numerous times when scheduling was difficult or delayed because they were “short a tech.” They always seemed to be “short a tech.”
--Also, the billing system was really disorganized. There were times we’d be looking around for a paper receipt to see how much I had paid them, how much they’d quoted me on price, etc., rather than just looking it up on a computer.

So the whole process of the install had a lot of issues. BUT, now that the install is done, I am really happy with my new stereo system. And I’m grateful to Anthony for all his advice. He made me aware of potential stereo improvements I hadn’t considered (video screen, Android auto, new speakers), without trying to push stuff on me. Also, the shop did a really nice job crafting custom molds for the Tweeters and installing everything so that it looks natural in the car. And Anthony couldn’t have been nicer about all of the issues I was having with the install and making them right. He was genuinely apologetic about everything and worked really hard to get fixes done as soon as possible.

So if you’re looking for a new car stereo, I do think it’s worth visiting The Car Stereo Shop and talking to Anthony. He’s great. Just be aware of the potential issues -- who knows, maybe they’ve improved things there by now.

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

name: David Woods
text: Message #2 Besides Michael Anders & Mr. Burnett & General mgr and others I also loved the service dept at Greenway Honda of Florence. The whole dealership receives 5 stars from me and I shopped around & they had the best price on my new truck.

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, David! We are elated to hear of your great experience, and that our staff continues to make you feel welcome and appreciated. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Trevor Joiner
text: Advance Auto is my go-to store for all things automotive. Tonight, I visited not for automotive needs but guitar needs. I'm a luthier (I build, repair, and restore guitars) and tonight I needed a fine polish to restore the gloss to the lacquer of an old 70s guitar. They didn't have what I was looking for (Meguire's Mirror Glaze #9) but the guy was super, super helpful and friendly. The friendly service, competitive prices, and amazing savings when using coupons for online purchases are why I will come to Advance again and again.

name: Michaela Carter
text: I went in to get an oil filter for my car and told them exactly what I needed. Well the lady rang up the wrong filter and I didn’t recognize it til I paid and picked up the bag and it was way to heavy. I told her that was the wrong one we got it corrected. I paid almost $18 for that and I knew the one I normally get is only around $10-11. So she gets the receipt and is scanning it to refund the difference and i thought it was completed so as I am walking out I check the receipt and nothing was refunded. I go to the back double check the pricing before saying anything went to the front to advise her there was nothing refunded. She proceeded to tell me that I seemed to be in a hurry so she was going to let me go ahead and go but in order to refund the difference I had to swipe my card again. So if you have anything with a price difference to be refunded make sure it actually happens and you get the receipt.

resp.text: Michaela, we apologize for the lack of attention regarding your whole visit to our Muscle Shoals location. Your feedback has been forwarded to the Field Leadership team of this store and they will address any additional training that may be needed. When you come in with exact details of what you want, that should be what you get. We hope that that you do give the store another chance in the future to provide you the proper experience. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts.

resp.text: Hello Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave this review! Here at Advance, we aim to provide exceptional service to all of our customers, and we're sorry to learn that your visit to our Muscle Shoals location resulted in a 1 star rating. Unfortunately, we cannot offer installation of headlight bulbs, however we do provide this service for wiper blades. We did make contact with this store, and unfortunately they were unfamiliar with this incident. We certainly apologize for any inconveniences this may have caused you, and hope for another opportunity to earn your business. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts and Batteries, we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Jimmy McDole
text: Carried my 2017 Ford explorer to Kinney's in August of 2018 for windshield replacement. When replacing windshield they broke the tabs on both side moldings of  the windshield. Instead of replacing the moldings and informing me of the breakage they glued the molding back in place. I did not know this had been done until the molding nearly came off while driving down the road yesterday. I had to carry to  body shop to be repaired by replacing both side glass moldings to the tune of $334.00.

resp.text: Sorry you had the problem Jimmy most moldings are glued on most vehicles this just happens to be a design flaw with your vehicle and if you would have came back to us we would have taken care of it for you

name: Adam Swanner
text:
They gave my wife a quote for $500 to replace her windshield.  The problems began when the tech showed up over two and a half hours  late to the appointment, then he informed her that they ordered the wrong glass, and that the price would now be over $900 to get the right glass.  When I called them to ask if they would stand by their original quote I was given lots of excuses about how their receptionist made a mistake and that we just spoke to the wrong person, basically saying it wasn't their problem.  After a short argument about standing behind your word, she requested a copy of the quote (knowing full well that it was quoted over the phone) and hung up on me.  I called back and was told that they couldn't afford to even give me a discount after wasting three hours of my wife's time, much less stick to the original quote they gave us.

I can understand making a mistake, or having an employee make a mistake, but at the end of the day small businesses fail or prosper based on their image and customer support.  They weren't willing to do ANYTHING to make the situation right, not even apologize for the mistake.

resp.text: Sorry you had a problem Adam, however if we had the wrong windshield perhaps we got incorrect information on what style, or equipment your vehicle had. We would not have inadvertently carried the wrong windshield to be installed unless we were getting incorrect information, and if that was the case of course we would not honor the original price if your windshield had more options on it then what we were told no one would. I would also like to add we usually do not give an exact time 4 mobile installations as to the fact there are so many variables that could keep us from making it to you in an exact time such as traffic, or mechanical breakdowns, the technician will normally give you a text or a phone call when we are providing mobile service to a customer and should never give an exact time.

name: Rick
text: There are several things that make this place the best.  I write this review after driving an hour and a half to do business with them.  First off all, they do more than trucks.  30 inch rims for your car they do it, headlights, taillights, lifts, flares, tonneau covers, etc... if you want it they can get it.  There prices are hard to beat.  But let me talk about what sets them apart from everyone besides their exceptional pricing.  From the moment you walk in you are treated with respect and that they are glad to see you there.  They listen very intently to what you want whether in person or on the phone.  This is missed by so many other places.  They go through getting prices as well as can show you options.  They do this to make sure you get exactly what you want for the best price.  While doing so they take notes on the conversation to ensure they don't have to ask you several times because they forgot.  Making sure they stay on top of it and making everything move flawless.  The business is very well maintained and the showroom is definitely a showroom, not just a display, spotless.  Respect and honesty is projected so loudly by the staff, you will feel like its your own family that runs the business.  I can't say enough about this because I have been there a few times for different purchases and  the entire staff is friendly as well as great to interact with.  As I return to them next week to make another purchase, driving an hour and a half versus using the internet, I know I am meeting people who are like family, getting the best price, the right part, quality parts, but also the best service that I have seen in the state.

text: I have always had good experiences here until today. I called about a part (a motorcycle spark plug) and asked them to look up the part. I was told to bring the plug in to confirm it was the right thing. I call back with the exact part number to be told that he already told me to bring in the plug to match it and proceeded to interrupt me when I tried to say anything. After refusing to let me speak to the manager on duty I was finally allowed to talk to someone other than this guy and come to find out they didn't even have the plug in stock! Shocker! If only he had looked up the part number for me...never doing business there again.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about the incovenience, Nichole. Our priority is to provide you with excellent customer experience and get you back on the road hassle-free. To get us back on track, please send an email to customer.reviews@autozone.com.

name: Jacqoura Towns
text: Very horrible service after my radiator was replaced. I was told to continue to put water in my car which I shouldn't  have had to do that if it was replaced with a brand new radiator. For the price I spent it better have been brand new. Smh waste of money and drive and my car is still messed up. Never again will I ever visit this location or any of them because of this bad experience.

resp.text:
Hello Jacqoura, we're disappointed to see your review, but we wanted to take the time to clarify the situation. When you brought your vehicle in to have the CV axle and P/S pump replaced, you noted that your engine overheated on the way to the location. Our service technician discovered a large leak in your radiator, which you agreed to have replaced. When you let us know that your vehicle had overheated again, we discussed with you the possibility of a damaged head gasket that was causing the overheating. We believe that this is the cause of the problem and suggested adding water to prevent it from overheating while you are needing to move the vehicle. We would be happy to take a look for you, as we believe this is the cause of the overheating issue. Please let us know if we can help you with this repair. Thank you, Jacqoura.
Chris, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Julius Matthews
text:
I'm not a very car saavy guy, but do know customer service. I signed up for an appointment through USAA RepairPal and thought that this place would have integrity. I was wrong.

I took it in one week. That Friday I had to call THEM to get an update on a Lexus IS350. They told me they did a few test and had more to run. The following Tuesday they informed me that the control head need to be replaced. I told them I didn't want the work done. At that moment, not the Friday I called them, not the day I brought it to them, but that Tuesday I was informed that I would be charged $45 everyday the car remained there. Why wouldn't you inform someone of this at the initial dropoff?

So I get there and fortunately I was not charged the $45. I try to leave and the vehicle, which only the AC wasn't working and the TPS light was on. When I get the vehicle back my parking brake light, check engine light, power steering light, and my ABS light was all of a sudden on.

I used them through USAA and this is how they are with customers. Poor.

resp.text:
Hello Julius, we were disappointed to see your review. When you came in late to your appointment, we were happy to still accommodate you and take your vehicle in, and we tried to communicate that we weren't sure how long the services would take due to the schedules of our expert technicians. You seemed to understand this at the time, and you signed the storage fee disclaimer. When you called on Thursday, you said that you would pick the car up on Friday and return for the repairs on Monday. You didn't come in on Friday or Monday, so Tuesday, we called to remind you of the storage fee. We're sorry if any of the paperwork wasn't clear, and we were happy to waive the fee for you when you came to pick up your car on Thursday. We explained the repairs your car needs (which is why your warning lights are on), but we would be happy to go over this information with you again if you have any questions. We wish you the best.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Corinne Boston
text: Paid for a diagnosis on my brakes which was $40. Wanted to charge me 482+ tax for 2 rotors and brakes and said they wanted to take my old brake fluid out and put some new in,check my emergency brake and charged labor for each thing he was going to install. So after i talked it over with my granddad he told me to leave. i told them i couldn’t afford the price and then he tried to take the price down and take the brake flush and checking my back brakes off it came down to 373+tax  i thought about but i still declined. After that they did not say thank you for coming or anything. just gave me my keys. this is the second time this has happened trying to over charge don’t go here! go to tire engineers. i ended up having a friend doing my brakes paid for parts which was wayyy cheaper thank god ! Also my brake fluid was clean and did not need changing so they lied about that as well, and checking for my emergency brake ? nobody rides on there emergency brake. since i’m a young woman they will try and rip you off be careful ladies .!

We are sorry that we were not able to perform the work that was needed on your brakes. We brought the price down as we wanted to keep you as a client and to make sure you were taken care of. We are happy to hear that your friend was able to help. If you need anything, please let us know.

name: Alesha Hicks
text: Sure, they were nice and did the work, but when I got my itemized receipt checked by an independent mechanic from a different garage, their prices were way more than what should have been charged. The biggest one being that they charged for taking broken parts off, which is part of the work that goes into fixing it and would not be charged elsewhere (which was confirmed by another trusted mechanic my family has gone to for years). Get a quote and get it checked by someone else before you agree to the work.

resp.text:
Dear Alesha,
We sincerely appreciated the opportunity to work with you recently to perform brake maintenance on your vehicle. The brake pads that had been previously installed by another mechanic had several broken parts that needed to be addressed. We spent over an hour trying to salvage existing parts in order to save you the expense of new calipers. Our invoice showed we only charged a portion of the hourly labor rate to keep your costs down. I would be happy to discuss all of this further with you and address your concerns in a positive manner. Please give Jamie, the owner, a call at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience.

name: Beverly Ashley
text: They recommended I get rear wheel bearings on my vehicle. My car made awful noises after the work was done, I took the car to them twice after and they still did not fix it. I had another mechanic fix the car which was the same thing the left wheel bearings. Don't take your vehicle here, they aren't trustworthy at all and cannot even fix what they mess up.

resp.text:
Dear Beverly,
Thanks for coming into our auto shop recently. We were surprised by your review since we provided you with effective communication and excellent customer service. We replaced your wheel bearing and discovered a small evac leak. You also had us replace a headlight bulb and rotate your tires.

When you came back the next day and stated you were hearing a noise, our technician, Chris, took the car for a test drive and diagnosed you needed a new tire. You left our shop and purchased a used tire and then had us install it. The next day you came back and stated you were still hearing the same noise. Chris drove the car again and indicated that the used tire was no good. We even moved the used tire to the back to make sure the noise followed the tire, which it did.

Our team did exactly what was asked of us and provided you with an honest assessment of what your vehicle needed. We wish you all the best.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Darlene Strong
text: Micheal and his supervisor was so ugly to me. I will never go back to them. Not once did they call me about my car to let me know what was going on and when I called them they just said you can come and it. All it need is a sensor.

resp.text:
Darlene, we're sorry to see that you had a bad experience at our store. We aren't always able to let our customers know how long work on their vehicle will last, as we aren't always sure what repairs will be needed. We apologize that there was a delay in figuring out what was wrong with the vehicle, but we unfortunately had vehicles ahead of you that needed to be taken care of first. Our goal is always to meet our customers' expectations, and we regret that we weren't able to help more. We wish you the best and hope you were able to find the service you needed.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Rocky and Beverly McCurdy
text: Wanted to do a new review since they replied and lied on my other one. This shop lied and said I bought a used tire and brought it to them to put on after they told me that’s what I needed to stop a noise that they caused. Good used tires down the street replaced my tire not you all. I really need you all to stick with one lie. They also doctored paperwork saying I came up there earlier this year then sent out another letter saying I didn’t.  These people are CROOKS I promise you that. I’ve been told if they find out someone else fixes your car, they pay other mechanics that people take their cars to to fix the damage they did to avoid going to court. Good things don’t come to those who lie and don’t do right by people.

name: Laura Vines
text: I took my Subaru in for an oil change.  I asked them to look at the brakes to make sure they were good since it had been awhile.  The guy told me I needed rear brakes, and offered me a good price.  I could not afford it at the time, so I waited.  In the meantime, I spoke to a co-worker, who said, "OMG, don't go there!  I was there really recently and overheard the employees talking about one of the guys there who was so bad and told people they needed work they didn't need done, and were joking about it.!"  So I took it to another place for a second opinion, and they said I did not need brakes!  So buyer, beware.  I put one star because I had to put a star to post this, but I would not put any stars if that was an option!

resp.text:
Dear Laura,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. We appreciate your review and have looked into the issue you raised. We are a family owned automotive center and we strongly enforce providing our customers with an honest assessment of their vehicle needs. We treat all vehicles like our own and value each customer’s time and money. We are sorry if you were not satisfied with your last visit to our center and welcome the opportunity to discuss all of this with you. Thank you very much!

name: travia thomas
text: We just left the shop 30mins ago & when we made it home my belt started making a strange noise. We open the hood to find the oil stick wasn't closed all the way and a drill was stuck in between my belt and melt under my hood.... Wow I hope my belt isn't ruined and I have no future problems!

resp.text:
Hello Travia,
We appreciated the opportunity to service your vehicle for you. Shortly after you left our auto center, our technician noticed one of this tools was missing and we called you immediately to confirm the tool was still under your hood. You indicated you had the missing tool and our manager sincerely apologized for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really appreciated you bringing the tool back to our shop the next day. Once you arrived, we were happy to inspect the belt and pulleys and found no damage. This was good news.

It was our pleasure to adjust your tire pressure and also install your fog lamp bulb at no charge, to compensate for our mishap. Everything seemed fine when you left our shop and you thanked us for our assistance, so we are a bit confused by this negative review. We are happy to discuss this with you anytime, and encourage you to contact one of the owners, Rick or Jamie Martin, at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

text: I have been very pleasant going there l being going for some years

Our auto care team feels very lucky to get to work with you. We are grateful that you have trusted all of these years. Our goal is to there when your vehicle needs repair. Thank you for posting this review for us, Linda!

name: Eli Ashley
text: Easily the worst car shop I've ever been to. I would suggest going here if you want to see 5 mechanics chilling in the back room while 1 guy does most of the work. I've been here three times and they've all been awful. The most recent time I went I got an oil change. Not even a week later my car started acting funny and my change engine oil light came on. I looked at the preferred date to return and it said 2/30/2016. If they don't even know how many days are in February I don't see how anyone would expect them to properly fix cars.

resp.text:
Dear Eli,
We are very sorry to read that you are not happy with our automotive services and that you are experiencing auto issues. Our oil change sticker is generated by a computer and it sounds like it was a simple error that created the incorrect February date. We welcome the opportunity to discuss what happened and try to reach a positive outcome. Please contact the owners, Jamie and Rick Martin at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!

name: Denise D
text: I dont know much about cars but I came to this shop for a problem that was temporarily fixed turned out they missed what was really going on i always keep my receipt so i showed my new shop the work i had done and the new shop Im at told me what they missed im done... wasted 400 to not get my problem fixed I heard bad things about this shop its all true dont waste your time or money

resp.text:
Dear Denise,
We were sorry to read your review. Please know that we warranty all of our work and would welcome you back. Please feel free to reach out to us to schedule an appointment. We look forward to working with you and making this right. Thanks, Denise.

Jamie and Rick, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care
(205) 945-8863

name: Jaime Fields
text: Awesome great fast service!

name: Charitee Truss
text: I let them put my heater core in 3 days ago my car was running good just didn't have heat now I have no car to drive cause it barely cranks and cuts off every 5 mins but the workers can't tell me what's wrong this ain't right somebody please help me I had my own brand new heater core and antifreeze they charge 180 for labor extra 80 for hoses now I'm out a car

resp.text:
I am very sorry to read that your vehicle is not performing adequately, Mrs. Truss. I checked our records and we were happy to replace the heater core you provided on your 1992 Chevy Caprice. After assessing the car, we recommended replacing the other heater core and hoses, which you agreed. The car was still not performing well after the second assessment, so we then recommended replacing the throttle body. You asked to take the car for a second opinion, and let us know they provided you with the same assessment; the throttle body needed replacing. We stand behind all work where the parts are provided by Precision Tune Auto Care, with a 12 month guarantee. I am happy to work with you to find an affordable and honest resolution to get your car running in a reliable manner. You can reach me at (205) 945-8863. I look forward to talking with you soon. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Mel M
text: On Jan 19, 2019 at about 1pm I took my car to this Precision.  If I could give zero stars I would.  They were to fix a Cv boot leak and replace pads on my front breaks.  The employee got into a car accident and damaged my car.  In addition, the break work was incomplete.  I had to after waiting over 5 hours immediately return to them for noises in the breaks.  But back to the accident, the police took statements from the witnesses.  The report states it was Precision Tune and Auto care at fault.  The employee even stated he was sorry and didnt see the other driver.  They were intially so appologetic. When I tried to contact Precision about repairs the manager Chris said he was waiting on the police report.  I kindly had my insurance make a copy for him and delivered it to him.  I call week later again asking what will happen or if someone will contact me.  He gives a different story getting short with me and saying they arent responsible for anything.  I asked if his company's insurance co will call me he got short with me.  I have complained to corporate but since this is an independent franchise their hands are tied so they say.  They charged me 584 for work performed and my car still has issues and damage to the body because of the employee's negligence and nobody is willing to fix the issue.  Who wrecks your car and then tells you their not responsible.  Well the manager Chris did.

name: Justin Hamilton
text:
I WILL NOT DO THIS AGAIN.

SOOOOOO...where to begin. So this is my third visit to this campus, and needless to say, I'M PISSED. In a twenty-four hour period, I've seen this place three time, with minimum 1.5 hour wait, except for today. I come in the third time for the oil change with tire rotation, and I am denied service same day for the rotation. Ask for the same discount on tire rotations with oil changes since I have to come..even back again, and I am denied that. I understand business is jumping, but I would've been fine with a 50% off (normally $60), but can't even do that. Being a customer here the last minimum 5 years, this has to be the worst service and answer I've received, definitely when I'm spending my time to come and patronize, and giving chance after chance.

text:
This place just tried to charge me 546.00 for a tune up!!!!! 36.00 per spark plug, &226.00 for labor!!!! I went and bought my spark plugs for 46.00(all six) and  the mechanic isn't charging a third of the price they are asking! This is highway robbery!!!!

Then I called another Precision Auto Tune and was quoted almost $200 less for the same service on the same car what in the heck is going on at that Homewood location that is really sad $200 more that is so ridiculous!!!!!

name: Katherine Miller
text: I wish I did not even have to give one star as this place is so awful. I have paid close to $1,500 in repairs here just for my axle to break because it was not properly repaired. Now that another mechanic has my vehicle he told me the control arms were put on incorrectly causing further damage to the car, the sway bar linkage was held by electrical tape, and I'm lucky I didn't lose control of my car and kill myself driving it in the condition WHICH I PAID WELL TO HAVE FIXED! It is not only completely shady and unethical but dangerous. I hope someone sues this place and gets them shut down before they kill somebody! Seriously, don't take your car here unless you want a near death experience.

resp.text:
Dear Katherine,
We are very sorry to read that your recent visit to our Precision Tune Auto Care center did not meet your expectations. It is our sincere intention to provide every customer with exceptional service. We are very proud to offer a 12 month, 12,000 mile warranty on all services, when the parts are provided by our center. We were happy to allow you to provide your own parts for us to install and our team recommended other services, noted on your inspection sheet. The axle is under warranty and we look forward to working with you in order to find a positive resolution. Please contact Rick at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

name: Tashona Reese
text: Seems I'm not the only person who's gotten ripped off at this location. I was charged $800.00 for a Brake job. I paid because I was told my brakes were at 10% and having started a new job across town, I didn't want to take a chance to continue driving on them. The staff was super friendly as long as they got their money but, when I called the next day to inquire about how they price their parts, of course nobody knew anything. I left my number for the manager to call me back, this was in September, 2015 and I still have not received a call. I also reached out to corporate and they informed me that it's out of their hands because each location is independently owned, but they would however forward my complaint/ info on to the regional maanger, who I have yet to hear from. I have no problem paying for services rendered, but I do have a problem when businesses are shady.Do not go to this location.

resp.text:
Dear Tashona,
My name is Rick Martin and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. I read your recent review and am sorry that you feel we overcharged you. We went over all of the costs with you before beginning the service on your vehicle and you approved everything. We do not wish to lose your business, so please contact me to discuss this further and hopefully we can find a positive resolution. I tried to contact you and got only as far as voicemail. I look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, Rick (205) 760-9904!

Hello Concerned Parent, I wanted to let you know that we are very sorry that you felt like your daughter was not taken care of to your satisfaction. I am a parent too, and I truly understand the value of a trustworthy vehicle for our children to drive, especially when they go away to college.

I spoke with our manager and he tested the battery when your daughters vehicle was towed to our shop. Our testing indicated the battery was defective and also showed swelling on the side. When a new battery was installed, the car started and your daughter was able to drive it once again.

We are a family owned auto shop that takes great pride in providing each customer with honest, affordable, and friendly car maintenance. I would be more than happy to discuss all of this with you, in hopes of reaching an amicable solution. Please contact me at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience, or provide me with the best way to reach you and the best time to call at the following email address: jmartin@ptacit.com. I look forward to talking with you. Thank you.

name: Danny Vines
text: These people will rip you off. Charge you for parts and service that you don't need and take advantage of people in desperate situations. Stay away from this place at all costs.

resp.text:
I am saddened that your recent experience at our auto center did not exceed your expectations, Danny. We work very hard to provide each customer with honest, affordable and professional auto maintenance solutions. We towed your 2000 Jeep Cherokee to our shop after you could not get it started at a local gas station. After running a few diagnostic tests we concluded the starter was bad and you agreed to have it replaced. Once that was done we continued with our testing and also recommended replacing the ignition switch, which you also agreed to have replaced. When asked if we could put the old starter back into the vehicle, we recommended not doing this, since our comprehensive testing showed the old starter was bad. Autozone ran a test on the old starter as well and came to the same conclusion; the old starter was bad and should not be reinstalled.  I am happy to work with you to get your vehicle back on the road and can be reached at the number shown below. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham
(205) 945-8863

name: Frank Buchanan Jr. (VooDoo)
text:
The employees of this location is not well versed in customer satisfaction and have a tendacy to have a sharp mouth. One of the store managers has manhood issues and thinks that all should bow down into him when he's nothing but pie. His name is Chris and have been employed by Precision multiple times...he has been known to steal cash from the register and also, had a bad drug habit as well. I'd strongly advise that you take your vehicle elsewhere. The owner of this Precision also has other locations around town and he doe not care about truth concerning how his business is ran but rather gotten money hungry at the expense of his employees and the customers.  Nor is their word any good for they tell you what you wanna hear but not man enough to deliver. All Precision Tune locations need to be under new management or close their doors for good.
I speak this in truth for I was once employed with this establishment. I'm an ASE Master Certified Diesel & Gas Technician...yet was treated with disrespect and was lied to about the pay scale. I've seen firsthand the deceit & trickery of staff. Nor do they abide by standards placed before them in order to maintain a respectable business. Of course there's more to the story but enough has been said to bring the customers awareness up..for it is my duty & obligation to expose such when at the customers expenses.
It speaks volumes when you bring things to their attention yet they fail to acknowledge you or allow an explanation....so I chose to terminate my employment and since then...I've been trying to contact those in charge so that I may retrieve my other toolbox at the Pelham location but have yet been able to. Goes to show the level of care when they lose a highly trained technician because the so called service manager has no real knowledge of automobiles but is allowed to make decisions above his experience...but I'm being hindered in accessing all my tools since i can't the owners to meet me there to get my belongings. The Pelham store momentarily closed due to lack of business but yet they don't see as to why when it's self evident.
Please take your business elsewhere...even if it's to one like Hellen Keller...you'd have a better chance of getting professional lasting repairs.

Attention to management: I need my tools from the Pelham location and have notified Chris and txt Rick only to receive absolutely no reply. If interested in the truth....please contact me....

resp.text:
Hello Frank,
We always appreciate receiving reviews from our valued customers based on services received. Since you have not been a customer at our auto shop, I believe this review in in direct violation of the Google Review Guidelines which state: "Off-topic reviews: Don’t post reviews based on someone else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you’re reviewing. Reviews aren’t meant to be a forum for general political or social commentary or personal rants.” We kindly ask that you remove this review from our Google page. I am happy to make sure you have all of your tools mentioned, and encourage you to please contact Jamie at (205) 945-8863 to make arrangements. Thank you!
Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

name: Tiffy carr
text: Car is even worse now. Barely made it home tonight . 7 hours again spent today in there with a newborn. Unacceptable so... Calling corporate back.

resp.text:
Dear Tiffy,
We are sorry to read that you are experiencing automotive issues. Our records indicate when the vehicle was brought to us, the engine was running hot from the fan not working and we also detected metal shavings in the coolant system. We recommended repairing both issues at a very fair price, and you asked us to only replace the fan. Our main goal for all of our customers is to provide honest and affordable automotive repair solutions and stand behind our work, which we feel we did throughout this entire process. We are more than happy to discuss all of this further with you in hopes of reaching a reasonable solution. Please contact our Precision Tune Auto Care center at (205) 945-8863. Thank you!
~ Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

We want to make this right for you. Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

Brandy Bright
205-945-8863

I will be going back tomorrow when they open .

resp.text:
Dear Te’Aira,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham. We were happy to perform an oil change and top off your fluids for you. Our initial inspection of your vehicle indicated you needed the following maintenance; brake inspection, CV Axle replaced, cracks found in a belt, and multiple oil leaks. Our team performed the oil change and you asked us to wait on the remaining items. We encourage you to give us a call at (205) 945-8863 to discuss your recent visit and also to make an appointment to have the rest of the maintenance performed. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!
