name: KJ MullinZ
text:
🔥Workers involved:
MIKE (Store Manager)
THOMAS D. (Employee)
Date of incident: 2/20/21 - 4:30-5:00pm.

🔥Bought a refurbished starter from there a few years ago. Returned it because it went bad and had a warranty. Did not want to deal with another refurbished starter, so I requested a brand new one. Was told they cannot get a brand new one which is fine. So they told me I could return the defective refurbished starter I had for a refund so I can use that refund on buying a new starter from another store. At that time, that particular employee was real helpful and kind to me.

Then the incident on 2/20/21 happened when I returned on that date with my defective starter. was dealing with the store manager Mike and his employee Thomas D. at the time. I was told that the starter needed to test bad in order for me to get a refund which is fine, because I had my mechanic test the starter beforehand and I recorded a video as evidence. After waiting a good few minutes because it seemed like something was wrong with the machine, the store manager Mike comes out and says that the starter tested good, but that he would still honor the refund. I told him that's fine, but the starter should have tested bad because my mechanic already tested it and I watched him test it, so I pretty much told Mike that the machine is to blame, then he got defensive and rude with his tone of voice about the machine clearly stating that the machine was not incorrect. To avoid further debating, I directly said to just do the refund. His attitude regarding the situation was unprofessional and unacceptable.

What makes the situation even worse is the fact that the employee Thomas D. asked me for my driver's license on returning the defective starter which should not have happened, because I have my receipt. When I asked him why he's asking for my driver's license, he said they were supposed to do that on returns, but that's obviously not true. Something didn't feel right, so I called another advance Auto parts store about the situation and that store told me that advance auto of Enterprise were in the wrong for taking my driver's license. My driver's license has the address to my Mother's home because it's an old address and I am not comfortable with that address being on file because I'm protective of my mother and concerned for her safety. I do not trust people I don't know, and I definitely do not trust that advance Auto parts store anymore and ever again.

They acted very shady and I felt discriminated because I'm part Asian. I've been shopping there off and on for years for myself and for my Mother. As of now, I am no longer a customer and I want my information out of that system immediately. Yes, I got my refund, but I shouldn't have had to go through that much trouble to get it, or feel that uncomfortable. Everything that happened that day was pretty much recorded on my phone along with two eyewitnesses that were with me in case I need them for future reference.

resp.text: Hello KJ, thank you for leaving your comments about your visit to our Enterprise location. We have forwarded your concerns to the store leadership and apologize for the experience you had. In no way does Advance Auto condone discrimination and we will be investigating the allegations. Please feel free to reach out to our customer service department at 877-238-2623 to provide any more information and thank you for choosing Advance Auto.

name: grace skidmore
text:
Their motto is to treat you like family and they do! professional, friendly caring and kind this team exhibits performance excellence. They are expeditious and knowledgeable plus willing to go the extra mile to get the job done. When they have to deliver less than desired news they are forthright and honest. The integrity of this outfit is refreshing to find and is a credit to the long history and tradition of being customer-centric.

John and his crew will take care of you and your auto repairs. No need to go anywhere else.

name: Ashraf Hijaz
text: Best customer service in town, no Ethanol in their fuel.

name: Jose Vazquez
text: Personable and kind staff. My car battery died and they had someone come tow my car right away. The mechanic got to it really quick and my vehicle was ready for pick up the same day. The mechanic took his time to explain other issues he saw and was able to address — he even called ahead and asked if I wanted my oil changed. Highly recommend bringing your car here. Just call ahead and ask if it’s busy since the shop is pretty small compared to others.

name: Charlie Pennell
text: Cloverdale Service Center is my go to place for all work needed on my car. Great service and always professional. Anyone needing any work done on their vehicles check out Cloverdale Service Center.  John and his team always treat me like family.

name: Penny Weaver
text: There's lots to like about Montgomery's Cloverdale neighborhood, and at the top of that list is Cloverdale Service Center. Not only is it a convenient stop for high-quality gas, John and his skilled staff provide prompt, dependable service on most anything your car may need. Need a set of tires? John can suggest the best choice for your vehicle, order and install them with no hassle for you. We dropped our car off at closing time on Monday, and it was ready to go, new tires in place and aligned, before 11 the next morning. It is a comfort to have a reliable resource like Cloverdale Service Center nearby.

name: Amanda Giddings
text: I got stuck in Montgomery on my way home from Pensacola and was fortunate enough to find this amazing auto shop. They managed to fix my car despite it being hard to find parts near them and got me back on the road within a day. With me being a college student traveling alone and getting stuck somewhere I’ve never been, I was beyond grateful to have found this place. They showed me the problems with my car that led to it breaking down and told me exactly how they intended to fix it as well as how much it would cost. The people there were also very kind and accommodating. If I lived in the area, this would be my go to auto shop and I certainly intend to go there again if I ever find myself in the area. I recommend this without question for anyone seeking auto services in this area.

name: Two Brothers Pressure Washing
text: The Best Auto shop in montgomery! All the staff are super knowledgeable, friendly, and treat you like family. Plus they will check your car while they pump your gas!

name: John Martello
text: Excellent work done quickly and successfully at a very fair price.  I can't recommend Cloverdale Service Center enough.  Also, they're a bunch of good guys!

text: Great place to take your car or truck.Friendly service. Knowledgeable mechanics.

name: Kat Serafin
text: Honest work and fair prices.  I paid $100 to the Toyota dealership mechanics to plug in the computer and tell me nothing was wrong with my car - I doubt they even lifted the hood, let alone test drove it!  John at Cloverdale Service inspected and replaced burned out spark plugs and corroded battery wire - something the previous mechanics should have easily diagnosed if they'd bothered to look past the computer screen!  Got everything fixed up, plus oil change, for an extremely reasonable price, and now my 13 year old car runs like new!  This is my go-to mechanic from now on!

text:
New to the area and didn't know anyone who could suggest somewhere to get my car worked on who I could trust. Looked online and saw "family environment", "great people", "great service" frequently associated with Cloverdale. Those reviews were nothing short of the truth. All of the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and genuinely cared not only about getting me in and out, but made a lasting impression on me personally.

I only had minor service done, but my time was not wasted ...like you normally feel when you sit at a car shop for hours just to get an oil change. I was in and out in less than 30 minutes!

I would suggest Cloverdale to any and everyone I know.

name: K. E.
text: It has taken me a few days to fully process my service experience on 5/7/21. I scheduled a service appt online for my Stelvio. I also checked the box for a loaner vehicle. I was scheduled for 4/27/21 for an oil change. Once I checked in I was told by Tom Williams, Manager, that I was not required to have any major services done on this visit but maybe the next time I would need to have my brake fluid flushed. I let him know that I would need a loaner vehicle. His response was, We don’t have any so Johnathan will take you to work. Once I picked up my truck and I was driving off I immediately noticed a different feel to my truck. I just thought it was different because they had done a tire rotation. A few days later I noticed a noise when I braked. It gradually got worse and louder. I called and spoke with Jonathan. I told him about my concerns. He told me it was probably a rock stuck between my rotors and that if it was the brakes my sensors would have let me know it and its probably just a rock but if I brought my truck first thing in the morning it would be a quick and easy fix. He told me they didn’t have any appts available and that they didn’t have any loaner cars for me to drive while they inspected my truck. When I arrived on 5/7 Jonathan stated you are gonna have to leave the truck with us you need new brakes and rotors. I asked why and he said you are metal to metal. So that’s when I immediately started asking what happened when I brought my truck last week, he apologized said the tech just didn’t catch it. I asked what about my sensors, why didn’t they go off, he stated the sensors are on the inside and this was on the outside pad. None, of this was making sense to me. I asked him for a quote for the service to be completed and of course it was approx $700 with a 10% discount. I’m fuming inside by this time bc not only have you all inconvenienced me when I could have had this service done last week, but I was in danger and you lied on my vehicle’s multi point inspection, or maybe you didn’t even do an inspection at all, but now you’re gonna double charge me for labor. I asked him who is the service manager and he stated Tom was. I explained that every time I have come here you all have told me that you do not have loaner vehicles but the last time I was there(for my oil change) he told a customer on the phone “oh no worries we’ll put you in something when you get here and you’ll be on your way”. Johnathan replied, “Oh that was probably a Maserati owner and he’s gonna put them in a loaner Maserati”. I stated, “so you are telling me that you all hold certain customers to a higher standard because of the type of car they drive”. He stated they don’t have any loaners, and someone could drive me to work. I literally paced the parking lot in disbelief bc of the lower standard of service based on the brand name of the car I drove, the oversight of my right rear brake being completely gone and scrubbing metal to metal, and the fact that over half of the cost for me to have the service done was a charge for labor for some techs that clearly half do their job. People think that it’s a myth that women get mistreated when it comes to their vehicle service but I experienced it first hand. I could have chose to be an irate customer but because I am a black woman I chose to keep my feelings, emotions, and anger inside and take the poor customer service I received. However, I do have a choice in what type of car I drive and what type of customer service I feel I should receive. I was even just considering upgrading my car. I did not feel valued and I don't think they provide the same level of customer service across the board.

name: Michael Kidd
text:
I don’t often leave reviews, but in this case I definitely have to because it is so well deserved, by several people, at Birmingham Alfa Romeo.

I recently traded in my 2017 Alfa Romeo Gilulia for a 2020 Giulia. Definitely the best car buying experience I’ve ever had.  I was given a fair price for my trade, and the sales price of my new car was more than fair.

My salesman, Beau Beggs, made sure I completely understood every single item during the buying process.  He is very well versed in all aspects of the Alfa line, and took the time to ensure I understood the operation of all the new car’s systems.  From the time I walked in the door, until the time I drove away I never felt pressured or hurried in any way.  For the first time, buying a car was actually enjoyable.  Thanks Beau!!

Now I get to brag about the service department manager, Tom Williams.

About 800 miles later I was driving home from work when my sunroof blew out for no apparent reason.  Needless to say, it kind of freaked me out.  I called Tom while I was still on the interstate.  He didn’t avoid the problem, didn’t ask a bunch of questions, and even though it was late in the day, he didn’t suggest any other avenue to solve the problem other than to bring them the car.  Because the glass was still falling from the sunroof Tom sent a tow truck to pick up the car and ensured the driver wrapped the car to prevent any further damage.

When I arrived at Birmingham Alfa I found out that all the loaner vehicles were out.  That didn’t stop Tom from taking care of the situation.  He simply put me into a used car (another Alfa with only 2500 miles) until another Alfa loaner vehicle was available about a week later.  In the meantime, Tom communicated the issue with Alfa, and made sure they would take care of the problem, and of course they said they would.  I was told parts were on order, and Tom would stay in touch with me as repairs progressed, which Tom did because, well... He’s Tom and he’s the best.

When the sunroof blew out the glass hit the trunk and the spoiler, causing several paint chips.  I knew they would have to touch up the paint, and that the paintwork would cause the value of the car to depreciate, and talked to Tom about it.  I knew he would do whatever he could to remedy to problem.

What I DIDN’T expect was what happened next.

I received a call from Tom.  He had communicated the issue up the food chain, to include Alfa themselves.  The Alfa brand very, very rarely has any issues at all, and they were more than a little surprised to hear of this one.... and they definitely wanted to make things right.

Birmingham Alfa, due in no small part to Tom Williams’ leadership and superb customer service, replaced my car.  My brand new car.  With another brand new car.  No hassle, no hoops to jump through, no problems at all.  In a word:  Amazing.

So.... I say all that to say this;  If you are looking for a new vehicle (or even a used one) I cannot recommend a dealership more highly than Birmingham Alfa Romeo.  Go there, find Beau Beggs, buy something.  You will not be disappointed.  As a matter of fact you will be pleasantly surprised in the experience.

Sooner or later you’ll need that vehicle serviced.  When you do, take it to no one other than Tom Williams. There is no comparison.  I have never been so pleased in the caring customer service he has provided.  both on my 2017 Alfa that I traded in, and the new one I am currently enjoying.

I don’t know who actually owns Birmingham Alfa, but if you happen to be reading this I want you to know you’re doing something right.  Keep up the good work, and keep your good people like Tom and Beau.  People like them are what keep your customers  coming back.  I know I’ll be back, and I’ll keep recommending Birmingham Alfa to others.

Thank you Beau Beggs, Tom Williams, and Birmingham Alfa, for being the exception to the rule.

name: Darryl Harlow
text: First three kids on Sunday told my sister to use channel locks instead of a line wrench to do the job line wrenches are designed to do, take off, and reinstall break lines. They seriously told her, then me, use channel locks, or vise grips! My reply was, uh, somebody Else might want to work on the break lines at some point!!! Then the next day, the grouchy old guy ringing us up for the correct parts, refused to give me my military discount, even though I had my VA card, and had mentioned it before he finished the transaction! For crying out loud, it was applied to the first purchase, that was returned because they were the wrong dang parts! I'm sorry, but after my third visit to this store, I'll drive to the fairhope store, Foley store, or Robertsdale store before I'll go to this store ever again, it was as bad as the one in Mobile.

resp.text: This is never the impression we should leave, Darryl. Being knowledgeable about auto parts and providing the best customer experience is what AutoZone is all about. We're disappointed we let you down. We're always listening to our customers and making improvements. We hope you give us another chance in the future to take care of your automotive needs. Thank you for sharing your experience.

name: Tosha Moody
text: I called yesterday to have my truck towed nd the guy who answered was the one who came nd got me nd my truck. It didnt take long for him to get there at all. Wen he got there to get my truck he was very nice nd even was gonna try nd help me figure out what was wrong with my truck. I knew what it was but him trying to help me was awesome. Also wen u get in the tow truck with the driver usually u would feel awkward nd some drivers r quiet nd wont talk but we talked about our kids nd our spouse. Its good knowing that some people still do try nd make conversation instead of being creepy nd quiet lol.. I would recommend Kilgore towing to anybody that needs a tow. They r very fast nd professional nd made sure I didnt sit out in the hot sun for hours waiting for a tow truck to pick me up like most tow companies would make u do.. Thank u so much again for the help. I would post his name but i dont think I asked or heard him say his name if he said it.

name: Jeremy “Eli” Vaughn
text: I had Audio King do an install of a double-din CD/DVD head unit, two Cobalt 12 inch sub-woofer's in a box, and a 1000 watt amp, all of which I provided. I called them in advance, and set up an appointment to have the install take place. They promised me they'd bench test the amp I provided to see if it functioned properly before installing it. After sitting at their store for 2 hours waiting, I decided to get my brother to come get me to go get a bite to eat. I got a call from them telling me that my amp didn't work after I'd left, and they told me that I'd have to have a new amp to get the subs to work. So I gave them the OK to install the new amp, which I purchased from them for $130.00. After 4 hours waiting total, they finally had the job finished, which was a RIDICULOUSLY long wait for a simple sound system installation. When I checked out the job they'd done, they had replaced the heater control wrong, and I couldn't use the knob for changing from cold to hot on the panel. So I fixed that myself while sitting in front of their store. I paid for the job, a total cost of $270.00 for installation, wiring and amp, then I got ready to leave. I noticed the amp of mine they'd said didn't work was missing, and when I asked where it was, they assured me it was in the trunk of the car. So I got in to leave, and decided I'd check just in case to make sure. Of course, the amp WAS NOT in the trunk. So I went back inside and had him check to see if they could find it, and of course, one of his employees brought the amp back to me. Today, about 3 weeks after the job was done, I had a friend hook up the old amp just to prove to me it didn't work. The old amp worked PERFECTLY, with no issues whatsoever, and actually hit better than the new amp they'd sold me! So not only did the owner of the business LIE to me and tell me that my amp was worthless, but he also tried to KEEP the amp from me, knowing it worked and figuring I just wouldn't care that they kept a broken amp. Of course this business does not do refunds, so now I am out the cost of the amp they sold me for no reason other than to steal money from me. DO NOT USE THIS BUSINESS, AS THEY ARE UNPROFESSIONAL, THEY TAKE FOREVER TO DO THE JOB THEY PROMISE WILL BE DONE QUICKLY, AND THEY LIE TO YOU ABOUT PRODUCTS YOU BRING IN TO THE STORE AND TRY TO STEAL THEM FROM YOU.

text:
On Nov. 7, 2018 I went in to get an oil change. Told me it might be awhile, that was ok with me, had to shop anyways.
About an hour later the called me, as I was driving away I noticed they had not reset my oil life gauge..I turned around went back and they acted like it wasnt a big deal. But, they reset it.
On the 17th of Nov a team of of us went to Kinard Fl to give a Thanksgiving dinner to that community. On the highway, the plate under the car that protects the engine fell on the road, the noise made me pull to side of road. Luckily, there was a mechanic with us, who got under the car and took it off..
It was put back on with a plastic screw and a zip tie From getting my oil changed!
Needless to say, walmart TLC will never see me again...or about 25+ people in this area who were either with me or have heard this story..We are still telling it btw.

text: I highly recommend this place! My Mom and I were on our way to Charlotte, NC and were planning a night stay in Montgomery. Our battery light on the dashboard came on about 50 miles out. We made it to the hotel that night as the car dies out! We figured it was the alternator. The next morning (btw, this is Christmas Eve), we look on Google for places to service the car and two others whose sites showed opened at 7am didn’t answer the phone. So we called Performance Auto Repair at 7am thinking to leave a message because they open at 7:30am. Well the phone rang once and they answered 30 minutes earlier than their opening time! They worked hard for us, got us a towing service right away and fixed the problem by 10:30 that morning! They were a God send!! Definitely go to them when you need! Thanks guys!!

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

name: Alice Yelder

This was the first and last time we will ever use them. There expertise should've been used and should've reached out to us and have customer service and just plain sense but all they could see was money. What about fixing the problem and all they could tell us was "we did what you asked", what great regard for customers

resp.text: We’re very sorry that you feel like you had a bad experience. We strive to have good customer service. Give us a call Monday morning or if you’d like, we can call you and we will do what we can to change your experience.

The technician that worked on my car "fixed" a few issues from the work and informed me of the issues. This was a free set of extra eyes. The price was reasonable for the work performed, they basically had to 4 wheel align twice because of the extensive work done to the suspension.  I definately recommend Performance Auto Repair. I will be bringing my other project cars here for similar service.

name: Jack Harrington
text: At times my pickup would misfire and lose power. After reading my Nissan check engine light code, Performance Auto Repair replaced the catalytic converter. The check engine light was not on and the truck had a lot more power. However, the truck continued to occasionally misfire and start loosing power. This would last from 1 minute to several minutes before resuming with good power. Without any engine codes indicating the issue, they continued to search for the problem.  The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence!  I will be using them for future repairs/service. I will recommend to friends.

He would pull the products up on the computer that I was interested in and show me what they looked like on the vehile.  He made excellent suggestions and made it easy to get just what I needed.

The prices were good and the service excellent.  I would highly reccomend Proformance Auto Repair.  Ask for Zack and you’ll be sure to receive excellent service.

Bob

name: Jon Bernreuter
text:
I have a 1980 Oldsmobile Cutlass, and these guys really suck at this car. Years ago, I told the cashier I had a Cutlass, and he asked me what the make was. I told him, "Dude, it's a Cutlass. It's an Oldsmobile." His response to me was, and I'm dead serious, "Sorry man, cars aren't really my thing.”

Back in February, I needed a new alternator. Super simple, easy to find part, never had any trouble getting one for this car. Round one, the one they sold me was clocked wrong. We tried to clock it ourselves, because my car was immobilized 1hr 30min away and I didn't want drive to the nearest NAPA to return it. Well we took it apart wrong and broke all the wires.

I took it back and explained what happened. They told me they couldn't do a warranty swap because I broke it. Which I'm sure is technically correct, but also a really bad way to handle it since the part they sold me was wrong, and I had the old one when they sold it to me. Two separate cashiers looked at the old one and the new one side by side and sold it to me anyway.

I just bought a new one instead of fighting it for round 2. The guy that sold me the second one accidentally just gave it to me, assuming it was a warranty replacement, AND refunded me on my card, so I actually made money on this transaction. Which is a good thing because this one immediately whined because it had bad bushings straight out of the box.

Round 3, I gave up and gave an auto shop a ton of money to buy one from a specialty shop already clocked and install it for me, because a 15 minute home repair was taking a week.

A week or so, another shop thought they discovered a radiator leak (I later found out the top hose was just loose and spraying coolant, so this is all really ironic). I went back to NAPA and asked for advice. Fatal mistake.
One of the guys, and he's super nice but dumb as a box of rocks when it comes to cars, sold me some Radiator Stop Leak. I also bought some other radiator additive that supposedly helps rejuvenate the o-rings or something. Not sure how that is possible for something that doesn't actually go inside the cylinders, but this guy works at NAPA so I'm sure he's got this.

He tells me I can dump both of them into the radiator and it will be fine. I follow his advice and read the instructions on the bottle. The system had just been flushed and filled, and the radiator and water pump are less than 5 years old. I let the car idle for 15 minutes and run the heater full blast.

I drive the car for 30 seconds and the hot light comes on, and the shift point for first gear has shifted up. I drive it to the shop and the guy immediately tells me I ruined my coolant system, and probably cooked the transmission, because Radiator Stop Leak is garbage and it does damage. They had to take the radiator out and all the hoses off and blow them out by hand, because the system was so clogged up they couldn't even flush it out with the radiator machine. It cost me $371.

So these $20 additives clogged up my cooling system to the tune of $371, and now I need a new transmission to the tune of $3,000. My car is parked because it will be at least 2 years before I can afford to fix it.

Radiator Stop Leak essentially laughed at me on Twitter, and I don't have the receipt anyway, AND NAPA DOES NOT ARCHIVE RECEIPTS. They have computers, but I guess they just don't save them on purpose. I can get an archived receipt from Guitar Center for a windscreen I bought in 2006.

Anyway, these employees are all super nice and they try to be helpful, but do not listen to them because they are all dumb as hell.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Jon Would you mind letting us know more by emailing customersupport@napaonline.com so we can try and help? Thank you! - NAPA

text:
Our battery died and we drove to a national auto parts store that advertises they will install your battery after you purchase it. After they refused to install a battery for us, we called this location knowing that we would arrive 15 minutes before they closed. We were told they would stay open if needed.

Even with paying $12 for the installation, we saved money by getting our battery at this location. The best part, however, was not the money we saved it was the customer service. Sterling is awesome and Walmart should pay him to teach a class on customer service to other locations. He is an excellent communicator and even assisted with the battery installation. We will be back.

name: Alycia E
text: Don't waste your time like I did. Instead just make the trip over to Honda in Columbus. The service will be top-notch. I travel constantly and have owned Honda's for 25 years. I have been to dealerships everywhere. I had a minor issue that could have been fixed quickly. Upon arriving at the run down shop the workers did everything they could to avoid acknowledging me. Wish I could have got his name specifically in the parts dept. He literally jumped on his cell phone when he saw me walk up. He didn't have a name tag on. Then I went into the service dept door and the man behind the counter has the audacity to tell me we MIGHT get you some time this afternoon. Mind you I'm traveling through which I mentioned, and I'm a single female. The issue literally just required a look at and some advice. Being in the medical field I understand being busy better then anyone. BUT there is never an excuse for being rude, and dismissive in business. I literally drive 45 mins to another dealership because you guys were so rude!

name: Jackenstein
text:
If you’re not sure, DO NOT come here!
Last week I stopped in the service department to ask if they would be able to fix my car’s broken sunroof seal. It is torn, off of its track, dry-rotted and very obviously needs replacing. The man at the front desk walks out with me to my car to see the problem and sees it as clearly as I could. We went back into the shop to set up an appointment that ended up being for a whole week later which was excessively long for the possibility of my car getting flooded if it rained. Today after the week had gone by, I took my car in told them my name and that I had an appointment, which they seemed not to even have on their books of me scheduling, asked for my address, phone number, and for the keys. Nearly 2 hours later I finally get a call back from them saying they didn’t have the part in stock, that they hadn’t done any kind of research on what my options were before my appointment (which we agreed they would do), told me they couldn’t get the seal as an individual part but would have to replace the whole sunroof instead, and that if I wanted that done it would be over $700 for it or if not that they would only charge $110 for running their “diagnostics”. A fee for “Diagnostics” to look at my car for no more than a minute to tell my seal had dry-rotted and needed replacing, really? It ended up being $117.70 after an additional charge of “supplies and/or hazardous waste removal” for a single floor mat, some identifying tags for my car and keys and some receipts. Not to mention there wasn’t a seat cover used despite their own disclosure sign saying they would be using them to slow the spread of coronavirus. I do not feel as though this charge was necessary and very much should have been avoided if they would done the work that was expected of them ahead of time. They will not be receiving any more of my business nor should they receive yours if your issue isn’t urgent or too difficult to do yourself.

name: Jennifer Keller
text:
I took my car to be serviced for three warning lights that repeatedly came on intermittently  (VSA, Power Steering and Emission). They stated it would cost $120 to diagnose the problem. Four hours later they called to tell me they found two pistons misfiring but it would cost another $120 to go any further to determine what was causing it.

I would give a negative number if possible. This service department is BY FAR the most dishonest service department with whom I have ever dealt in the past 34 years that I have been driving. I wouldn’t take my bicycle to them for repairs!!

name: Kati's World
text:
Back in February I brought my car in for just an oil change, but it ended up costing me over 400 dollars. However, I was willing to pay for it since I live over an hour and a half away, and it is a big deal for my car to be safe. Immediately after I left I noticed that wind was whistling through one of my doors and my brakes were squeaking. Then my radio completely stops working, and I decided to give this place another chance. We then brought my car in to get diagnosed, and were not made aware that they did not have a shuttle or anyway for us to leave the property besides uber.  After the diagnoses we got told by the service lady, to bring our car back in two days on Wednesday and that our rental would be free for two days, and that warranty would be covering the costs. Later that day we get a call from this same lady and in this call she tells us that my car would cost us at least 1800 dollars to get fixed, and that we had to pay for the rental car that we were driving. They also said that the pipe that needed to be fixed was bent in on purpose, and that we had done it (keep in mind that the only people who drive this car are two females who know nothing about cars). We were livid. They put the car back together and we got a second opinion, and turns out what they stated is wrong isn't.

The sales lady also reprimended a child for something she knew nothing about. I would give this place zero stars if I had the option. Overall, this is the worst experience I have ever had with a car place!

text: Feel like I got a good deal. Photo is of a different lot. But King got my business on this same model. Saved $875 off LaGrange Honda.

The model I wanted wasn't available on the lot, so they picked it up and drove it in from Huntsville, keeping me informed every step of the way. Call Rodney at King Honda when you are in the market for your next vehicle.

text: Really appreciate Stacey W for getting my part secured in a hurry on a saturday! Very dependable!

name: Maggie McCoy
text: I've been going here for a number of years for service on my Honda. I don't have anything but good things to say about them! I've always had a great experience and they really value loyal customers. They've kept my car running in perfect condition and never made me feel like they were upselling anything or treating me like a woman who doesn't know anything (a rare quality in my experience with car service shops!). They always take time to explain to me what was done and why they did it. They clearly indicate the wear on each of the car components so that I have a record and can anticipate service that I might need in the future. I went to another Honda location once and they said I needed new brakes. They didn't give me any other reason than the service guy's opinion. I took my car to King Honda and told them that the other place had said I needed new brakes at my next visit. King Honda measured the wear and said it wasn't necessary based on the wear. I was very impressed by the fact that they went by the numbers rather than taking the chance to sell me some brakes that I didn't really need quite yet. Even after I moved away from Auburn, I still come back to get my car serviced here. Thanks to everyone there for keeping me a happy customer!

text: As someone who dreads going to auto repair shops, I am happy to say that my experience at King Honda Auburn-Opelika was completely easy and stress-free. The staff was very nice and helpful, and I did not feel that I was being taken advantage of like I have at other auto shops. Great service!

name: Barış Köprülüoğlu
text:
Dealerships=Stealerships. King Honda is a good example of this fact.
My battery cable got corroded. I got my car towed to King Honda. It took them 4 days(!) to figure out the problem and they said the cable should be replaced which costs $260. I said no and got my car towed to Auburn Starters and Generators. They cleaned up the cable for $10 in 15 minutes and the car worked just fine. Honda didn’t even bother cleaning up the cable (which is something very easy for them to do) and charged me $60 diagnostic fee. STAY AWAY from King Honda! They will try to steal your money from the very first moment you walk into the service.

name: T Moraes
text: I came here to get my car serviced. They completed the service faster than anticipated and the staff were knowledgeable and friendly. They provided great customer service and they were very accommodating.

I am VERY Appreciative of them for helping me get a New Honda Fit! EXTREMELY SATISFIED‼️

name: Paggie Lim
text: just purchased my 2012 Honda Fit Sport from King Honda on 23 July 2016. LOVE TERRY!!! please ask for Terry if you happen to stop by. he was so helpful from start to finish. I just stopped by to look but ended up leaving with a car that I'm in love with!!!!

name: demarrick evans
text: We were very pleased with how we were treated at King Honda!  I didn't feel pressured to buy as I did at other dealerships.  Crystal, our salesperson, helped us tremendously, fought to get  us the best price.  I would recommend anyone looking for a car to stop by here.

name: Robert Litton
text:
Called to make an appointment to get a replacement key made for my truck. I asked very specifically how much it would be for a new key AND to have it programmed. I was quoted a price. I arrive at my appointment and they tell me it will be nearly double the price I was quoted AND they’d have to have my truck for 90 minutes.

I genuinely understand mistakes happen. But both of these problems could have been avoided with clear and accurate information. I had to walk home and not have my truck on my off day when I had errands to run. The service manager took $10 off, so I guess there’s that. I won’t be back.

name: Cody Cryer
text: I just bought a used Audi from King Honda, and had a very pleasant experience! Max Johnson helped me in the sales department from the start to finish and made sure I was completely satisfied with my purchase.  The service department was also a big help as well, Jacob Esco made sure my ride was in tip top shape before it was driven off the lot. 5/5 overall experience! If you are looking for a new or used ride, Max Johnson at King Honda is the guy to go to!

name: Jake Stewart
text: We purchased a used 2016 Honda from King.  After the sale, they disclosed that they didn't have the second key. Or the owners manual. Then we looked underneath the car and discovered various pieces of plastic missing and duct tape holding the remaining plastic onto the car. It took a few days, but they did rectify the plastic situation.  However, we still don't have the key or manual. The salesman was polite and made the repair process pretty simple.  Unfortunately, he didn't seem to know a single thing about our model of Honda. He wasn't able to answer many questions. I know Honda makes sales training manuals for each model. You should start using them, King. They are pleasant folks, but just do your due diligence and keep your eyes open.

name: Minehwa C
text: Josh at the parts department is extremely helpful.  I ordered a handle for my Odyssey from him.  I did not realize it is very involved to put the new handle on.  He helped me opened up the cover to get the screws out.  I was very happy with the service.

name: Destiny Smith
text: Went to the $79 sale and was told by an employee all that was needed was valid driver license!! Got down there and waited in line only to be told you have to have a down payment and excellent credit! False advertisement and a complete waste of time!

name: ang robinson
text: Great prices friendly staff. I will be back for my next car

name: TheFlashHayden
text: We have bought 3 cars now from this dealership.  My parents have bought from this dealership and my in laws have bought from this dealership.  Each time it has been a great experience!  Starting with the Sales Manger Kenny to the sales team of Shannon Culligan and Mike Pitts. These guys know how to work for YOU and not your money.  They genuinely try to help solve your particular problem or need without an end goal of just trying to SELL you a car.  No one these days want to be sold a car by someone.  They want to be guided in the right direction that best fits their needs.  That is what this team has done every time we have been there.  We live 2+ hours away now and will continue to make that trip back to Auburn/Opelika every time we need a car!  Thanks again guys!

name: Jennifer Spooner
text: This was one of the best buying experiences that I have had. Taylor was very accommodating. They gave me an awesome deal! Would recommend to everyone to go here and get a honda!

name: Bugman1324 Britt
text: Everything was great! Preston was fast and reliable with the services given to us today. Very much recommend this dealership to friends and family. Thank you so much for your help!

name: Gabe and Christina Arrington
text: Ask for Max when you go to King Honda!  He's the best person that we've ever dealt with when buying a car.  No hassles...he gave us a great price from the start, great value on our trade, and was even great with our kids!  Ask for Max!

name: Gabe and Christina Arrington
text: Ask for Max when you go to King Honda!  He's the best person that we've ever dealt with when buying a car.  No hassles...he gave us a great price from the start, great value on our trade, and was even great with our kids!  Ask for Max!

name: Bill L
text: I was there  for airbag recall, alignment and mount and balance of two tires. That's all I requested. They charged me twice what they said it would be for mount and balance two tires. $42 per tire in labor. They also changed the oil and topped floods which I did not request. I had done both myself less than a month ago so it did not need either. They charged me $15 for topping fluids and $35 for oil change. They removed the $35 from the bill. I didn't catch the other charges until I got home and was looking at the bill. Seems very deceitful to me.

name: Anthony
text: Great Sales Dept.  Andrew Reed gave me a great price on a new CR-V and I got a great offer for my trade in.  The experience was hassle free and I didn't have to deal with gimmicks!  Thank you King Honda!

name: Jennifer Spooner
text: This was one of the best buying experiences that I have had. Taylor was very accommodating. They gave me an awesome deal! Would recommend to everyone to go here and get a honda!

name: Chris W
text: I drove 50 miles to look at a Honda Odyssey and was extremely disappointed.  The salesman I first spoke to knew nothing about the product (I could forgive that because he was new to the job) so I asked to speak to a sales manager because I had some questions that the first guy couldn't answer.  The manager gave me a look like I was inconveniencing him (strike 1).  I asked him if he could give me some pricing options on a few models and he said it would be very difficult (funny...the Toyota guy gave me several different models with prices - strike 2).  I told the manager that I couldn't do business with him unless he could give me actual prices to compare and that he was competing for my business between a Toyota and Honda dealer to which he replied that he wasn't (strike 3).  What kind of manager doesn't think the customer has an option between car brands???  I've never met a sales staff that was not willing to work with a customer to provide every bit of information possible to make a sale.  It was like these guys wouldn't even talk to me unless I promised to buy a car from them on the spot...sorry I don't make $35k decisions on the spot!  I've also never met such a rude manager.  A good manager helps a customer and earns their trust.  If this is what you want, DON'T shop at King Honda in Auburn!

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Wife spends a lot of money here! GREAT  dealership

name: Sadegh Poozesh
text: I just got a Honda accord on this Jan. After 3 months one of the tires got leakage, I called them, but they don't take any responsibility even to check the tire. Although Honda is manufacturing great cars, but this is not a good dealership to purchase Honda cars from.

name: Paul_Melvin _
text:
Unfortunately the people working there seem NOT very nice AND their knowledge is lacking in terms of quality of tires for the cars.  It didn't seem to know the difference between the different ratings of higher quality and model brands of tires.  They seem kind of wishy-washy on their recommendations.
It appeared that they were just trying to push the tires that they have in stock which was a model of tire I didn't care for.
They also push for a lot of services that aren't required.
I question their ethics.
The entire service department smells badly.
Honda Corporation should question whether or not this dealership should maintain their franchise.

name: Jemall Finley
text: I hate when I feel like m being rushed off of the phone by a service adviser, very unprofessional. Called to get information about a nation wide recall on my ignition switch, i'm going to take my business to another Honda dealership

name: Benjamin Meade
text: As for the Service Dept: we have taken our car here for 5 years now and they have always been polite, professional and have taken good care of our vehicle. Great place to have a Honda serviced!

name: Joyce Nelson
text: High dollar cars not willing to work much with you

name: Caleb Barrow
text: I got my car serviced here and it was a very good experience. The staff was friendly, and I wasn't pressured to have any work done other than what I took it in for. I got an accurate estimate for my wait time. I imagine I will be back.

name: Anthony C.
text: Customer service is not a big thing here. I recommend go to either Columbus or Montgomery you may even get better deals definitely better customer service.

name: Sam Deal phone
text: Specifically about the parts department. Brought in a plastic piece that had popped off the hatchback. Guy came out, got the vin number. He and the lady spends 10-15 minutes looking on the computer. Comes back with, "we don't sell that part seperately. It is a component." Told them I found it online. They continued saying it wasn't in their catalog. Guy goes out and takes a picture of where the part was. That still doesn't help. Fortunately, I took a screen shot of the part I had found two days ago online. Called back, gave them the exact part number. It is now in their catalog. It is about 4 dollars more expensive to order it it online (with shipping costs), but would be worth it to avoid giving king honda a penny.

name: Kate Mel
text: King Honda Car World should change their method of operation.  Their method appears to be unethical, in that they pushed while appeared unnecessary service.  I.e., my tires needed to be changed immediately and transmission services, etc.  Additionally, once I received my vehicle back, I inspected and found several items that were functioning previously no longer functioning; such as, gas cap was loose which cause sensor malfunction, clock on the display was blinking as if they disconnected the battery, and the bluetooth include pandora was malfunctioning as well.  The overall experience was awful.  I will never bring my Honda to their service again.  Definitely not recommend this place to anyone.

name: Ryan Gaither
text: When I first walked in door I knew it didn't feel right. The lobby is non existent and the sales floor is outdated. It looks like a scene out of the movie Fargo where the sleazy car salesman works.  I was uncomfortable from when I arrived to when I told the salesman I was sorry I but I think I'll look elsewhere. He didn't take too kindly to that and pressured me to make a purchase because I otherwise wasted his precious time. He spent maybe 20 minutes putting together a quote for me. It was an all around bad experience.

name: Demita Preer
text: The service department is horrible. Drove 45 minutes to Auburn to get a second opinion on my car. Was told by a previous dealership that I was having engine issues. I was specific when I brought my car in for a diagnostic of what was told to me and also if it was the engine that I would not put any money in to the car, I would just get a new one. After sitting for two hours, I was told that it wasnt my engine that it was my timing chain. $1800 fix no problem, made my appointment to come back. Fast forward to appointment day, received a call from Buck in the service department stating that they fixed the timing chain, however they discovered issues with the engine. I was beyond furious. I specifically stated my concerns up front and you failed to do a proper diagnostic. After some back and forth they ate the costs and now I have to get a new car. Because of the horrible service in the service department, I will no longer be doing business with King Honda. It's sad because I really love their car salesman Shannon. I will be picking up my new car tomorrow from Lynch in Auburn.

name: Jonathan
text:
After having one of the worst experiences I have had at any dealership, I spoke with the manager at length.
The manager (Randall) explained the situation and offered any help he could. He also explained to me why the dealership was in ruins. They were moving to a brand new site in a few months. Their openness about their knowledge and non-pushy attitude allowed me to reach a decision. Their service department was extremely knowledgeable and forth coming about any answers I needed. Their detail department is also to consider. While hidden and a little run down, they work hard on any project at %110.

If I have learned anything, never let a first appearance or situation judge the entire lot. Always give a 2nd chance.

name: Mclovin Wilson
text:
I have been using them for a year or so for service. No complements but no complaints either. Then I needed a key. They ordered it and called about a month later. I never followed up so I assume the long time was that it slid through the cracks for both of us. Made an APPOINTMENT to get the new key cut for 2pm. Showed up at 2pm and was told it was going to be an hour or more before they could even get to my key. I was told that an appointment was a time to see a service adviser, the time has nothing to do when they would get to my car.
I had other things to do and said call when you can get to my car and I will come back.
Next day a lady calls and asks very rudely what I want to do with the key. I say that I value my time more than them, call me when you can actually work on the key or return it. She said it was being shipped back and immediately hung up on me.
I would stay away. Drive the 40 minutes either direction to  dealer that does not take the small town auburn family for granted. Any King dealership is out in my book.

name: Tizzo Heavy
text: Ok dealership. Service department has good techs but can be sketchy when it comes to fees on repairs. Get everything in writing.

name: Hilliary Sanders
text: In my opinion, King Honda is the worst dealership in the area.  After our first sales person left, I had to contact another sales person who happened to be the sales manager regarding a Honda Pilot that I was interested in buying.  The new sales person, test drove my current vehicle (Jeep Liberty), gave us a trade-in price, negotiated the numbers, wrote up all the paperwork on the new vehicle and said congratulations, it’s yours, hand shake, done deal.  NOPE, I go home, switch out all my personal items, bring back my Jeep only to be told that they made a mistake on the trade-in price of my Jeep, and that I would need to pay them $3000 more or give the Honda Pilot back....which I did and they sold it to another lady waiting to buy it that day!  How convenient.  Buying a car is supposed to be a joyous experience, and this experience was anything but!  I was so hurt, I had to wait several days before I was able to even speak about the situation.  My intentions for this review is to inform potential buyers that they should be proceed with caution when dealing with King Honda of Auburn!  -Genia B.

name: James Durand
text: They got the work done but they were unnecessarily pushy of services. They read my mileage wrong and told me I missed all of my major maintenance because of it. After I showed them they had done that wrong they grudgingly admitted I was doing things correctly. They also changed all of my settings in my car from the radio to the steering wheel and seat for 20 minutes worth of work. Finally they didn't acknowledge my wife as a car owner. They directed all questions about her car to me which seemed very inappropriate.

name: William Sharpe
text: Very helpful and nice but didn't find exactly what we needed.  Check them out.

name: Shinan Kassam
text:
Questionable service rendered. I seriously doubt they actually perform service that they say they perform. Every service our tires supposedly  get "rotated, aligned and balanced". After 30K miles there was extremely uneven wear on the front tires.

Also they claim to refill fluids. In this case they told us we completely ran out of washer fluid between oil changes, which we did not. Going elsewhere. Stay away! They are crooks.

name: Brandi Tate
text: I purchased my Honda accord from King Honda about four years ago.  Since then, I never came back to the dealership for anything until I received a recall on my car.  Along with the recall job, I was told that I needed additional work that totaled to $698.  I paid and a week later saw that I needed an oil change.  I received a oil change coupon through email.  I made an appointment to get my oil changed and told the lady that it came from my email.  On the day of my appointment (which I took off work to come to), I was told that I could not use the email that was on my phone and that I had to print it off if I wanted the service.  The guy's tone was not welcoming and he did not try to solve my problem.  I work in customer service and there is always something you can do for a customer that just spent almost $700 with you. I don't think I will return and I will not tell anyone they should come to your dealership because some of your employees don't value their customers.

name: Lindsay Durand
text: Not in the nicest neighborhood. I brought in 2 cars at once for an oil change and the staff seemed confused by 2 cars. Told me I had 30,000+ miles my car with 15,000 miles and tried to pressure me into doing normal 30,000 maintenance. When I refused because I knew I was not at 30,000 they then tried to tell me I was a bad and irresponsible driver. I made someone come out and look at the miles on my car to prove I was only at 15,000. He said that the guys in the garage must of screwed up and walked away. Never apologized for the awful things he said when he thought I wasn't doing required maintenance.

name: Christian Foster
text:
Brought my car in to have I looked at for a clanking noise. Was told it was going to be looked at. The year of my car was specified at drop off. Found out later that my car needed an axle replaced(which is understandable) and that there was a recall on an airbag. I should have been told upfront that my vehicle had a recall because now that it has been dropped off I can't have my car for several weeks due to liability. Then I also wasn't told up front that I couldn't have a loaner during the time period because I am 20 not 21. Now I am without a car for several weeks and I should have been told these things I would have to deal with up front so I could have planned around it.

I WOULD NOT RECCOMEND KING HONDA CAR WORLD.

name: Mike Tucker
text: Have had experiences with the service department only.  First time a couple of years ago I had the transmission fluid and filter changed on my Ridgeline and the price and service was acceptable.  The second time i needed the timing belt changed.  I got a quote from them for $1650 (ouch) but this included a number of other items that are listed by the "Maintenance Minder" plus more.  I then asked for only the timing belt and it was quoted as $700 (again ouch).  Also said it would take 1.5 days...hhhmm.  I have had this done on on the the same engine in a Pilot a few years back and it was less than $400 so I called McConnell Honda in Montgomery.  They quoted $460 and only 5hrs!  Well guess where I went!  How can Honda service centers less than one hour from each other be so different.  Obviously McConnell has something figured out that King does not!  Will NOT be taking my Hondas to King!

name: Dennis Kmiec
text: A dead AC in early July on vacation is a helpless feeling. Turned out it was still under warranty and 4 hours later we were cool again. Though we had to wait a few days to bring it in, we weren't going anywhere and they're next to a fine barbecue. And though I had to pay for the diagnosis. I wasn't going to argue.

name: Joe Carlson
text:
We had both a bad sales AND service experience.  We wound up buying a Honda Odyssey EX-L elsewhere.  We do everything we can to have all service on the vehicle done elsewhere, too.

Stay away.  In my opinion, it's hard to do worse than King Honda in Auburn.

name: Millionnah Thompson
text: Purchased a certified used 2009 Honda Accord EX-L in 2011 that had 20 something thousand miles on it. First off, the car is beautiful!  But over time and realizing that it has been burning oil and has horrible grinding (vtc actuator defect) when I start it,  I have realized that the motor is complete junk! My factory window tint is so bubbled that I can't see out of my back window, poor windshield visibility in the rain, leather on the door panels and center console is coming apart, transmission sounds like it slips and does not want to change out gears, absolutely no power when you are merging into traffic or at initial take off so bad that I basically have to floor it and it jumps to 6/7 thousand rpms and on top of it all my sun roof leaks!!!!  There have been so many service bulletins posted about defective parts that it is ridiculous!! I did the recommended oil consumption test and within 2 months my oil wasn't even touching the dip stick!! I am supposed to be getting my pistons and rings replaced as well as numerous other things (NOT by King Honda) but American Honda will not cover the cost for their KNOWN defects with certain parts and it makes me sick to know that I only have 107 thousand miles on my car and 7 months left to pay on this piece of worthless trash and I'm at a total loss basically!! The best way to waste $22,500 is to go throw it away on one of King Honda's vehicles! I will NEVER own a Honda again!! I can't wait to get a TOYOTA 4-RUNNER after I finish throwing away my money on this POS!!!

name: Hamza Alkhudaidi
text: Always good service with them! Highly trusted employees

name: Sam Bartlett
text: Worked with me when my newly leased car had it's windshield crack after less than a week, and didn't try to get me into more car than I could afford. Friendly staff, very down to earth people.

name: Debbie Turnbloom
text: They baited me with a a CRV that had navi. I had paperwork drawn up for a loan at my credit union in chelsea. king had already sent my credit union the bill of sale on the car with the right vin and then called me and backed out on the deal just a few hours before I was driving to auburn with the check.  They said they could not sell the car at that price with navi. I said that was the deal we agreed on, shook on and I had the paperwork for. Then the sales manager Randall argued with me telling me that I WAS BEING DISHONEST in wanting them to keep the deal they agreed to because they had made an honest mistake.

name: Carmen Smith
text:
In 2013, I purchased my 2013 Honda Accord from King Honda of Auburn. I must say, that the service rendered was indeed, "service with a smile." After my delightful purchasing experience, I returned to my hometown approximately 41 miles west of Auburn and elected to, for the sake of time, have all my service needs performed by the local Honda dealership nearest me. This would be the trend for the next couple of years until I started experiencing a problem with my keyless ignition system. Time and time again, I would go in to this local certified Honda dealership and my problem was never resolved. I was even told by them that the only way they could get to the root of my problem was that my car would have to stop working completely. Well needless to say, this caused me extreme stress and anxiety. At this moment, I picked up the phone and gave Mr. Dave King of King Honda Auburn a call. Immediately, he pledged his absolute commitment to working with Service Manager Randy Melius and the other dedicated service professionals to identify and fix my ignition problems. Within two days of making contact with Mr. Dave King and getting my car to King Honda of Auburn, my fears subsided. His service team did just what was assured to me. I am no longer living in fear of my car not starting which compromised the safety my family and me.

In closing, please know that the automotive professionals of King Honda of Auburn will be there for you years after the ink dries on your purchasing contract. Words could never express my appreciation to owner, Mr. Dave King, service manager, Randy Melius, and their bonafide service professionals for their commitment to meeting the needs of their customers!!

name: Austin Texas
text:
Wednesday 3/15/2017 @ 3:30p = 1-star
=========

If you readers out there own a honda automobile  and want to do a service here then you should think harder...

I am visiting my college kid here at Auburn and own a 2014 Honda Accord-EX.  The vehicle still have 40% life of oil before the next oil change.  Since I live some 900 miles away from Auburn and not sure when is the next time I'll be here.  But I want to get the oil change for my kid before I leave Auburn.  I came in the dealer at 3:30p and since this dealer is the smallest honda car dealer and pretty confusing if you are the first time visiting the service (no sign or direction to the service dept).  At 3:45p, I entered the door to the service counter and saw two man sat by the counter texting on their phone and asking him (buck is the name) if it is ok that I can do a quick oil change.  His replied was "we are closing at 5:00p and we are wrapping up so no more service for the day" I told him you have at least 1hr 10min left.  He notch his head but we are closing.

I laughed so hard because this honda service dealer is so much unfriendly and not willing.  How can you show up to work and not working?  Something is really wrong here.

I am writing to share my bad experience at "king honda service dept" so reader out there to save your time, energy and money else where you and the service you like other than king honda.

On my way out I stopped by the front sale office and share my experienced to mr. Randall / GM.  He seems to acknowledge my concerns and took down my contact info.

I took my business to "Express oil Change" 3min away from king honda dealer and they really treating me like a real customer.  My fav guys are Michael and Zack.

UPDATES...3/15/2017 @ 5:47p = 4-stars
========
I received a phone call from Mr. Dave King (the owner).  He first introduced himself and sincerely apologized to me of his service dept staffs behavior.  I have to give Mr. Dave King a lot of credit to reaching out to me as a upset customer and asked me to come back to his dealer to offer to do oil change if I havent done it (he actually said he would do it him self).  That enough to tell me that he genuinely care.  Instead he offered a certificate of free oil change on our next visit.

I want to thanks Mr. Dave King and Mr Randall for their action and care to their customers.

Because of these efforts I have decided to move my rating from 1-star to 4-stars.

name: Tisha Lilly
text: Longest wait ever, even with an appointment.

name: C. Dwayne Ferguson
text: Great deals on new cars. Great selection.

name: Barbara Sheppard
text: Older dealership. We will be happy when they eventually open the New one

name: Michael Araiza
text: Got my car serviced here.  Service shop is good.

name: Dwayne Ferguson
text: Great cars and courteous people.

name: Nathan Wohleb
text: Good people to deal with

name: Jerome Stinson
text: The service department is horrible!!!! I went there for an oil change and i ask the guy who you check in with at the service department  desk does all the fluid be top off he said yes. So after bout an hour and half they brought me my receipt and they said they was finish and I ask did they top off all the fluids again and he said yes. (With me knowing my coolant and power steering was low). So when I paid I proceeded to go outside and raise my hood and what ya know my fluids are still at the same level and I went back inside and told the sales rep. in which he then called the mechanic who did the work and he seen for his self he half ass the job (but I got a check list that all of that was done). But one of my relatives had experience the same thing a couple of months ago. It's a shame that you have to check behind someone if they say the job is done. BUT I WILL NEVER GO BACK AND WILL BE CHANGING SERVICE DEALERSHIP.

name: Sharon Rogers
text: Great service

name: angie t
text: Very nice folks!

name: Mark S.
text: Slow service.

name: Nath Arnob
text: There service is very low.  They don't even know how to deal with customers. The price is so high. Please  don't buy from here, just go to Atlanta, you will get much much better deals.

name: Charlie Nicholas
text: Great place

name: Shannon Cate
text: My favorite car people anywhere.

name: Melva Thomas
text: Not pushy or mean!

name: Nafiul Huda
text: Great service!

name: Teddy Patterson
text: Great staff and service!!

name: Priscella Holley
text: Great

name: Tony Blackmon
text: Great service!

name: Big Angel
text: Great!

name: Stuart Cope
text: Friendly staff, quality wotk.

name: Bill Shackelford
text: Not good

name: Mary Abraham
text: Good service

name: Crystal Melton
text: Fast and friendly service

name: Erik goldmann
text: Poor customer service, old outdated building

name: Stacy Jones
text: The BEST dealership in Auburn!

name: Yvonne Garrison
text: Friendly employees

name: Justin Osborne
text: They were friendly when I got my car fixed for the airbag recall, and very friendly when I inquired about a getting a replacement side mirror.

name: David Whitten
text: Over the years my family has purchased a dozen new Hondas from King..  The sales staff is super and the service couldn't be better.

name: Md Reza
text: Very unprofessional sales & service experiences . Sales guys are very unorganized and absolutely has no professional

name: Melinda Furniss
text: Customer care is awesome! Never have a problem.  Follow-up is awesome! My experience has always been excellent.

name: Debra Haiku
text: Went for an oil change it them over and hour, these guys were to busy running off at the mouth. Not only that they didn't tighten something because I'm losing oil fast!! Four quart in less then two days. I informed corporate today of this problem, this is a first disappointment with them.

name: Rena
text: Great customer service in the auto department. The young lady who waited on me was very polite and professional.

name: The Eclectic Mama creator
text: I went twice to get tires put on ...they did not listen to me when I told them what I needed . They made there own choice on what tires needed replacing and almost got rid of still good tires I had on there before. When in there own policy it states they are not to gage tires to know what’s bad or not.  they had claimed that the tires they had taken off were bad and practically said the second day I came in that they did me a favor even though my truck broke there lift that they should not of put on there lift in the first place but it was my fault. They acknowledged that there lift would not work  because my truck was too big....but went ahead and put my truck on the lift anyway the first day. Now the tires they were supposed to remove one was too big and was throwing off the trucks balance due to a different Walmart tire center. And the other one was a balding spare tire that they apparently did not look at at all or they would have not taken the still good tires off and almost through them away. The only good thing they did is make me realize that they can’t be trusted to do the job ....and don’t communicate with the customer properly. There may have been some polite people there at first but the second day I was there to get the problem fixed thinking they would be professional about it instead this I guess manager raised her voice at me and made all these claims that I had said this ...when I thought it was because I asked for a rotation I thought I had confused them and they had assumed what was right. I was not blaming anyone, I just wanted the work I paid for to be done. There were a few things that maybe on me but if they were real professional people they would not of teamed up against me like they did. In the end I went to a different tire shop and I did ask them to put on the tires Walmart almost thrown away and to gage them before putting it on to make sure they were not bad. And this other tire shop I went too said “ no your tire ain’t bad they still got a couple years on them if you use the truck regularly”

name: Rose Burgess
text: The cashier was too busy talking about everything to her co workers. The customers waited in line until she finished this conversation about a customer who had walked away with the co worker.   She waited on me and when I explained that my tire was only 14 days old and had a screw in the side wall I asked if the tire was to be patched or replaced.  The young lady proceeded to explain to me what road hazard meant and a new tire was out of the question (very loudly I must say).   The co worker who fixes the tires spoke up and said if the tire has a screw in the side wall the tire most likely will be replaced.  I thanked him and sat down.   This same cashier called me to the desk to get checked out.  I had to wait while she redid the paperwork so her supervisor could understand what happened (which did not understand).   So I waited till she rewrote everything and I was asked to  pay a pro rated amount of 11.00 for the new tire.  I paid this amount with no comment because she was so (confrontational and annoying) even though I felt it wasn't fair.  But that's the kind of people you meet today in stores they do not understand the meaning of customer service.  The service team did a great job, the wait for changing the tire wasn't long at all.

name: Josh B
text: When I arrived there was one car ahead of me. When that car was picked up mine was put in the garage and was there over an hour for a simple battery replacement and 2 new tires. No reason given for waiting over an hour for something so basic.  Go to AutoZone and get a battery installed in a few minutes and find an actual tire store.  Walmart doesn't care about you.

name: Moto Giant
text: So they lifted my truck up in the air and the dude went to the bathroom for an hour, and I'm still waiting for him to even pull the first wheel off? While out shopping hoping that my truck will be finished when I get back I was almost run over by a lift operator while he was texting, lots of fun at this Walmart

name: Cory Roberson
text: Had a tire mount cary in Great service very nice even the manager pitched in to bring me my tires&rims I asked them to put antiseaze on the lug nuts I brought with me and they did and zip tie it in a bag so they wouldn't make a mess dont get this from many walmarts but I'm happy they got my wife back on the road

name: Ms Q
text: Always helpful and great customer service!

name: Keyandrea Varner
text: Reasonable  car batteries

name: Fredrick Shaw
text: Great staff.

name: Brianna Lane
text: Good I guess

name: David Mckenney
text: Ok service

name: Kajuana Griffin
text: Very pleased wit service

name: Mablean Talley
text: Great service

name: Jacqueline Frye
text: Will be going tomorrow morning for oil change and tire rotation

name: wendy roberts
text: The guys that work here are fantastic!

name: Katherine Dickens
text: Not very helpful

name: Rodney Medders
text: , bad service lazy employees

name: Walter Thomas
text: Owner is very courteous and helpful.  Good service

name: Jeffrey may
text: The owner Mike Powell is knowledgeable and trustworthy soul

name: Dream Life
text:
Mike stole my retired Army Vet moms money and did not complete the job as promised .. ($2000) he told us on several occasions he would finish or plan a day to come and it’s now 6 months later and the job is still not complete ... we have begged him to do right but God knows and sees all ! He is to busy to complete the job he was paid for ... or simply just took advantage of my mom who lost my step dad recently!

He installed cabinets and didn’t screw them in at all.. he started electrical and didn’t finish .. he did not install shelves in cabinets .. did not finish painting the cabinets ... did not install the kitchen lights... put my handicap moms $400 cabinet outside and never brought it back in ... now it’s ruined ... this is sad !

His excuse was he was working on mr Cochran job but now claims he wasn’t ...

resp.text: Seal Auto Parts is no way involved in any thing like putting up cabinets for anyone at anytime anywhere where this came from we do not know we would like it to be removed and contact whomever it is that install the cabinets for you or whomever they were installed for sounds like they being the ones you need to contact you need to remove this from seal Auto Parts there for we will be pursuing slanderous alternatives we being seal Auto Parts have no intention in giving up anything for anyone at any time that we did not do

name: Charles Smith
text: Good southern mechanics shop.  Good people.  Very fair process on auto parts, service maintenance and tires.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Keith Dunnivan
text: Great people and helpful with many things

resp.text: Thank you again please come and see us again have a great day if there's anything we can do to help this please give us a call 334-855-2974

name: Damian Brown
text: Great mechanic, always willing to give honest advice. Thanks Mike.

name: paula lamb
text: Grate service Grate Parts and that wonderful home town people

name: rebecca oakes
text: Friendly

resp.text: Thank you for the five star rating please come and see us again if there's anything that we can do to help you please give us a call 334-855- 2974 have a great day thanks again

name: Katarina Essenmacher
text:
Never again. I came in to test drive a car they had that was the only one around that was similar to the one I wanted, with the intention of having them order what I wanted if I liked it. I was very clear about that from the beginning. The person we'd originally made our appointment with was too busy to meet with us, the two different salesmen we were bounced to spent a combined 20 minutes just looking for the car they had said they'd have pulled around when we got there.  They spent most of the time trying to convince me to settle for the one they had, which was the wrong color (not a huge deal) and a Limited where I was looking for an Ultimate and didn't have any of the specific features I'd picked the Ultimate for (a bigger deal). When they finally agreed that they could order the car I wanted, they tried to convince me to buy it faster, claiming that in the few weeks I was planning to wait until some new payoffs reported on my credit, qualifying me for a 0% interest rate, my trade would decline in value and that I didn't want a 0% interest rate anyway. They kept me another 20 minutes after I said I needed to leave for an appointment, and even had the sales manager come out asking us, "Why do you hate my car", to try to convince us to buy the wrong one again. They didn't even pretend to care if I got the car I wanted (even though I'd have been spending more money), they just wanted me to buy whatever they could push off on me right that second. Overall, a terrible experience, and I felt more like a hostage negotiating for my release than a customer.

After it was all said and done, I bought somewhere else, got exactly the car I wanted, in exactly the time frame I wanted. And despite the salesman's threats that my trade wouldn't be worth what I wanted to get for it if I waited a few weeks, I got $3000 more for it than I'd asked Tameron for.

name: Renae Patterson
text: Originally went to Tameron Hyundai looking for a used car.  We met Antoine Gray who was so helpful to us that when we decided to buy a brand new 2019 Hyundai Santa Fe Ultimate 2.0 we called upon him.  He is NOT pushy or aggressive which would have instantly turned us off. Instead he kept in touch either calling or texting us just checking in to see if there was anything we needed. He went out of his way to get us exactly the car we wanted.  When we picked up car both he and Christina did an excellent job of explaining all the features so we were comfortable driving it off the lot.  I had previously reached out to 6 different dealerships before deciding Tameron. Save yourself some time and just go to Tameron and ask for Antoine. I promise you will not be sorry.  (We got the  scarlet red one)

name: Laura Burke
text: Lawrence and David absolutely outdid themselves. They understood my circumstances and worked with me to get me back on the road. They spoke to me as a person, not just a quota to fill and stayed late in order to accommodate me. 10/10 wonderful service, definitely worth checking out, they'll treat you well. Thanks guys!

name: Kevin Wheatley
text: Excellent service. The service advisor Mitchell was professional from the moment I drove in. He greeted me and after I explained I was there for a recall/issue he went ahead and advised me of how long the service would take. He even checked the system to see if I had a plan to cover my oil change at my current mileage and advise me to come back within a certain mileage range. I didn’t even know my plan had these stipulations. I decided to wait for my car and it turned out that the recall service was even quicker than he advised it would be.
